Ghostly tendrils flicker and five Academy rings jangle as it raises a skeletal hand, enacting the arcane gestures of its first spell.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.30bioarcanewrait inline]

Beetle Knight.name: Beetle Knight
Beetle Knight.text:
Beetle Knight

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.6imgbeetleknight inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.XsoCB9j0dTu9Fp8E]{Beetle Knight}

Two insectoid legs hold up the beetle-like creature, rhythmically clacking as it skitters about. Two clawed arms scrabble beneath blade-like limbs as gnashing mandibles chitter under its beady eyes. A massive pincer-like horn protrudes from its helmet-shaped head and a tough blueish-silver shell protects delicate wings hidden beneath.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.40biobeetleknigh inline]

Belfray.name: Belfray
Belfray.text:
Belfray

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.7imgbelfray12345 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.s1BJqG1swvSRSKOo]{Belfray}

A shrill screech pierces the air as a large, misshapen bat swoops overhead. Its outstretched wings resemble elongated human arms, with flesh pulled taut to its deformed body. Rows of hooked fangs fill its maw below bulging, red eyes and a sniveling snout.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.50biobelfray1234 inline]

Big Linda.name: Big Linda
Big Linda.text:
Big Linda

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.8imgbiglinda0000 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.hiCxMUDyv04Grwev]{Big Linda}

The ground shudders beneath the approach of a monstrosity: a pale, green-white, bipedal reptile. A huge mouth dominates its skull-like face, as acidic saliva drips between rows of razor-sharp teeth. Spines run down its back and tail, and it's great body is supported by two trunk-like legs, though its feeble forearms appear nearly useless. It roars a sound like rent metal as it charges forward to devour you.

“Big Linda has proven well worth the lives I spent to capture her. She is the prize champion of my fighting pit, and a loyal friend. I am very much excited for you to meet her. Also, before you ask, yes, she bites”

—The Queen of Thieves

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.60biobiglinda000 inline]

Bigger Linda

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.9imgbiglinda0000 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.fKuKUeYl4Hm3uZb3]{Bigger Linda}

Thundering through the streets of Drakkenheim with a crash, the infamous pet of the Queen of Thieves has mutated and enlarged to unfathomable proportions. The Haze swirls around it, and octarine energy pulses in its sunken eye sockets. The broken hafts of weapons and old arrows are embedded into its scales, stuck deeply between its regenerated flesh. Its spined back is illuminated by webs of glowing octarine veins; its wide snout is filled with jagged teeth. As it opens its maw wide, the building contaminated energy at the back of its throat begins to glow.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.70biobiggerlinda inline]

Bloated Hive.name: Bloated Hive
Bloated Hive.text:
Bloated Hive

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.10imgbloatedhive inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.b9kW1jnyKxkpJnyi]{Bloated Hive}

Dripping with sweet smelling pus and mucus, the creature shuffles about on spindly limbs like a gangly ape. It has long gnarled fingers and an emaciated whip-cord thin frame. Where there should be a head there is instead a mass of pulsing flesh covered in gaping pores that extend down its neck and across its shoulders. Its body writhes with thousands of bugs crawling beneath its skin and swarming around its head. They burrow in and out of open wounds and sores and buzz in and out of its pores. It smells faintly of honey and sweat, and gurgles painfully amidst the chorus of buzzing and clicking of insects, as if the thing is painfully aware of its wretched state.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.8biobloatedhive0 inline]

Bojack.name: Bojack
Bojack.text:
Bojack

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.11imgbojack00000 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.KxEsBFH4fWW4L9Il]{Bojack}

This creature, which appears to be a dead horse flopped on its back, convulses and its stomach suddenly splits open, exposing its intestines and organs. Long, spindly, arachnid-like legs violently sprout from its torso as its stomach opens into a maw filled with sharp jagged teeth formed from the splayed rib cage of the beast. The horse legs limply hang in the air, as the creature skitters towards you with intense speed, intestines flapping around its maw like a sickly tongue. The head of the horse dangles lifelessly, but its mouth still gnashes and salivates acidic bile.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.9biobojack000000 inline]

Cacophonous Chimera.name: Cacophonous Chimera
Cacophonous Chimera.text:
Cacophonous Chimera

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.12imgcacophonous inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.3GyiTiyeMxJ8rXM5]{Cacophonous Chimera}

The Cacophonous Chimera's three heads include a chittering rat, a screeching harpy, and a howling garmyr, which together perform a madness-inducing chorus as they slaughter their prey. Its forelimbs are clawed rat-like paws, its rear legs are avian talons, and the beast's colossal furry body is borne upon massive wings of blood-red feathers with a slithering lamprey eel for a tail.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.10biocacophonous inline]

Chitter.name: Chitter
Chitter.text:
Chitter

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.13imgchitter0000 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.WgbbOKIZU9zWtC4T]{Chitter}

Scampering up the wall is a creature the size of a hound. It resembles a mostly hairless squirrel save for its bushy tail and patchy tufts of mottled fur. Its eyes are glassy and milk white, and its mouth seems almost human, sporting huge, pearly white teeth that grin maniacally. It frantically clambers upward, while chittering a maddening chorus with its clacking teeth.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.11biochitter0000 inline]

Crater Wurm.name: Crater Wurm
Crater Wurm.text:
Crater Wurm

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.14imgcraterwurm0 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.ukTeiVkr7lu0OuGr]{Crater Wurm}

The earth trembles, vibrating pebbles and dust. A deep rumble wells from below. Suddenly, stone cracks, extruding a titanic wurm. It rears its massive head, opening a petal-like mouth filled with long jagged crystalline teeth all pointed into its throat. Its body is covered in mudy purple plates with octarine spines jutting from between. Its hot breath sends octarine slime flying as it dives toward you.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.12biocraterwurm0 inline]

Dark Growth.name: Dark Growth
Dark Growth.text:
Dark Growth

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.15imgdarkgrowth0 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.OW8gIxvValK75uI4]{Dark Growth}

The remains of a corpse is splayed across a ruined wall. A chaotic mass of jet-black brambles and vines pours from its torso, clinging to the nearby stonework. Branches have burst from its form, and its neck erupts into another mass of plant matter. The skull is severed from the body with its jaw unhinged and hanging in a horrible expression, stuck in place by the writhing vines. Throughout this Dark Growth, flowers bloom in iridescent neon hues and the smell of sweet pollen and decaying flesh fills the air. You hear gentle whispers from a distant voice, distinctly familiar and beckoning.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.13biodarkgrowth0 inline]

Dark Growth Shambler

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.16imgdarkgrowth0 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.OAuzVKeBBG5dnNMY]{Dark Growth Shambler}

Staggering from the shadows is a gaunt humanoid with pale flesh and a hunched form. Vines and branches protrude from its gaping mouth and push through its flesh throughout its body. Flowers emerge from these growths, blooming in iridescent neon hues. A smell of sweet sugar and decaying flesh fills the air, and whispers begin to issue from it even though the creature's mouth doesn't move.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.14biodarkgrowths inline]

Digipede.name: Digipede
Digipede.text:
Digipede

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.17imgdigipede000 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.4B3hxfdkvjw70X7i]{Digipede}

Scuttling atop dozens of spindly legs, this grotesque creature resembles a mutated centipede grown to horrific proportions. A segmented body nearly thirty feet long undulates atop unnaturally bending limbs resembling emaciated human fingers. Elongated yellow fingernails crackle and scrape the ground menacingly as it moves. Dominating its fat, round head is a single, massive human-like eye that swivels frenetically with a disturbing, unyielding intensity. Its antenna sprouts above like an eyebrow, while tightly closed mandibles resemble bags under the eye. Its foremost finger-legs end in pincer-like talons thrumming with electricity.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.15biodigipede000 inline]

Drakkenheim Sewer Gator.name: Drakkenheim Sewer Gator
Drakkenheim Sewer Gator.text:
Drakkenheim Sewer Gator

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.18imgdrakkensewg inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.TKsuusZ8RaFkhVss]{Drakkenheim Sewer Gator}

Surfacing from the rancid sewer waters is a terrible alligator nearly fifty feet long. A jagged ridge of delerium runs along its back, ending in a fell crown atop its head as pallid skin frames its octarine glowing eyes. A thick, purple tentacle-like tongue undulates out of its tooth-filled maw. Strong and sturdy legs support its scarred body, attesting to countless battles in the ruins.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.16biodrakkensewg inline]

Effulgent Cnidarian.name: Effulgent Cnidarian
Effulgent Cnidarian.text:
Effulgent Cnidarian

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.19imgeffulgent00 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.kwu5egpBrYR5MCyl]{Effulgent Cnidarian}

A translucent bulbous mass floats through the air gently, throbbing neon colors radiating across its skin like a cosmic nebula or an eldritch borealis. A mass of thin strands dangle down from of the creature, pulsating with bioluminescent light. The tendrils move and glide about, gently groping and grabbing at objects as it passes by. The whole creature glows, illuminating the darkened city streets around it. A distant chorus of ethereal hums and tones fill the air.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.17bioeffulgent00 inline]

In the search for glowing rocks beware the mind jellyfish.

Elemental, Contaminated.name: Elemental, Contaminated
Elemental, Contaminated.text:
Elemental, Contaminated

“Contamination is best understood as an unraveling of the foundational aspects of magic; a breakdown of the laws defining the cosmos. The elements, so fundamental to the form of the Mortal World, are particularly susceptible to this corruption.”

— Grandmaster Wizard Eldrick Runeweaver

S ome Some mistakenly believe that eldritch contamination only affects organic creatures, but its warping influence can affect the fabric of reality itself. Delerium pollutes the earth, befouls the water, corrupts the wind, and suffuses fire, creating Contaminated Elementals.

These creatures can be found throughout the ruins, anywhere planar rifts and contaminated energy flow. They are especially common in the Crater Basin, Queen's Park Garden, and the Inscrutable Tower. These elementals embody the corrupted ideals of their elemental origins, desiring to grow, consume, and spread.

Spellcasters often summon elementals to bind their animus when making magic items. Contaminated Elementals are sought after for making delerium-infused weapons and items channeling contaminated spells.

Animated Delerium Sludge

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.20imgelementalco inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.ifYqW78hHqg7G3dh]{Animated Delerium Sludge}

A mound of iridescently streaked black muck lumbers through the ruins, splashing with each ponderous step. The sludge reshapes into a towering, almost human-like form, with slimy arms and think unsteady legs. A head bubbles atop its viscous body revealing a slime drooling maw and two hollows for eyes. Yet, it carries a strangely mirthful expression, as if finding joy in its grotesque existence. The mound emits a gravelly roar, full of sinister glee, and barrels towards you, undettered by the debris in its way.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.18bioanimatedslu inline]

Entropic Flame

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.21imgelementalco inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.qIZue3KpXIICDfaV]{Entropic Flame}

An elemental alight with purple-green flames illuminates the desolate streets ahead. Composed of cascading octarine fire, the elemental moves like wildfire spreading uncontrollably. Within the dancing flames is a scornful expression of rage. It crackles and blazes, the heat from its body distorting the air around it. The pungent smell of burning ozone and sulfur saturates the area, and flecks of cinder and ash whirl about, shedding from the creature as it glides menacingly toward you.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.19bioentropicfla inline]

Living Deep Haze

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.22imgelementalco inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.kcddqmgbTmYqPBL2]{Living Deep Haze}

The Haze enveloping you begins to churn and swirl, gradually coalescing into a dense mass of octarine fog. A ghostly visage emerges as a nebulous form takes shape, its features twisted in an eerie semblance of anguish. Flashes of contaminated energy crackle and spark inside the cloud, casting fleeting, sinister lights which mimic the movements of a tortured face. This roiling fog floats through the ruins, drifting like a specter haunted by its own turbulent essence.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.20biolivingdeeph inline]

Walking Delerium Geode

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.23imgelementalco inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.wOzaGFPwrhIiko6U]{Walking Delerium Geode}

A rich outcrop of delerium crystals glimmer from the collapsed ruin nearby. As you approach, the debris begins to shift and move. A hunched, hulking form, one vaguely humanoid, rises up with a chorus of crystalline clinks and grinding rock. The central mass of stone and crystal is supported by two short, stubbly legs of rubble, its arms and shoulders shaped from large boulders of brick and wood that end in balled fists bristling with delerium spikes. Its head, an elongated crystal, is marked by angles and fractures that gradually form into a sorrowful face.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.21biowalkingdelg inline]

Eldritch Cataclysm.name: Eldritch Cataclysm
Eldritch Cataclysm.text:
Eldritch Cataclysm

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.24imgeldritchcat inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.f1Bw3g42S8GOkg7a]{Eldritch Cataclysm}

A swirling vortex of dark clouds, debris, and icy shards moves in like an eldritch storm. Crackling octarine lightning fills the air, the ground rumbles and shakes with the might of the unnatural weather phenomenon, but this is no ordinary storm. Within the dark clouds appears a snarling face, its eyes and mouth like pools of octarine light. The creature is the weather itself, warped and infused by the Haze of Drakkenheim into an arcane and twisted form of life, filled with the uncaring and unbridled anger of a storm.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.22bioeldritchcat inline]

Fighting a thunderstorm with eyes might not be the weirdest thing you do today.

Graffiti.name: Graffiti
Graffiti.text:
Graffiti

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.25imggraffiti000 inline]

Statblocks: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.bH6Na0GkMzbzBKV1]{Graffiti}, @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.GVdbbOX0T7Yl8lHK]{Chorus}

Walking through the rubble-strewn city streets, scraps of parchment and bits of faded street art still advertise the events, political intrigues, and foreign affairs of that fateful eve. Broadsheets from the day the meteor struck feature the headline “Queen Lenore's Latest Outfit: Blue or Gold?” while scandals of Elyrian nobility and an interview with the latest champion of the Rex Colosseum dominate below the fold. The nearby debris coalesces into a crowd of figures that press against you, seemingly straining to read the page's changing headline that now reads, “Adventurers Assaulted on the Streets of Drakkenheim!”

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.23biograffiti000 inline]

Gravekeeper.name: Gravekeeper
Gravekeeper.text:
Gravekeeper

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.26imggravekeeper inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.LPB3YCeumvKMdpi2]{Gravekeeper}

Before you is a hovering mass of writhing appendages. Amongst its horrid and grotesque form you can make out the many faces of the long-lost gravekeepers of Castle Drakken, but their expressions are twisted in the horror of their last moments, and their eyes are hollow with a dim octarine light emanating from within. Covering the floating mass are hundreds of arms, several of them holding softly glowing lanterns. The lanterns glow with octarine flames that cast flickering shadows across the crypt. The Gravekeeper wanders amongst the dead, awakening them into grasping souls, clawing their way out of the many graves amongst the lordly tombs of the castle.

“The Royal Crypts below Castle Drakken housed the bodies of kings and queens, dukes and nobles of generations gone. They were tended by the many gravekeepers who worked diligently to light the lanterns below so the dead could have safe passage to the light. I shudder to think what has become of those crypts, and their keepers, in these dark times.”

—Overheard from a party of nobles in the Red Lion Hotel

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.24biogravekeeper inline]

Haze Husk.name: Haze Husk
Haze Husk.text:
Haze Husk

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.27imghazehusk000 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.uzeoZGIO0MULOG8a]{Haze Husk}

The walking dead wander Drakkenheim draped in the ragged clothes from their final day. Their wounds billow with eldritch energy and their putrid flesh slides over their bones. Hollow black eyes stare, and their gaping mouths groan in pain. Each face wears the agony of their last moments while shards of delerium protrude from their skin.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.25biohazehusk000 inline]

Creating Haze Husks

A character who knows the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oyE5nVppa5mde5gT]{Animate Dead} spell can consume a delerium fragment worth at least 100 gp per corpse as part of casting the spell to animate them as @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.uzeoZGIO0MULOG8a]{Haze Husks}. Additionally, a character who uses a delerium crystal worth at least 1,000 gp per corpse when casting @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCreateUnde] with a level 8 spell slot or higher can animate two @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.wH7qy4fPdtUV6yOG]{Haze Wights}, or three @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.wH7qy4fPdtUV6yOG]{Haze Wights} by using a level 9 spell slot.

Haze Wight.name: Haze Wight
Haze Wight.text:
Haze Wight

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.28imghazewight00 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.wH7qy4fPdtUV6yOG]{Haze Wight}

The stretched skin of this undead warrior is purple and bruised. Clad in broken armor, a deep gash in its breastplate marks the lethal blow that ended its life. Eldritch magic wells within the wound. As it catches sight of you, its face twists into a hateful scowl. Its dead eyes burn with spectral energy and contaminated magic seeps from blackened claws. In a cracked voice, it howls a delusional challenge: “To arms, comrades! Drakkenheim will be free of these monsters!”

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.26biohazewight00 inline]

Hazewing Moths.name: Hazewing Moths
Hazewing Moths.text:
Hazewing Moths

Rounding the corner, you stumble upon a bizarre alleyway where streaks of delerium cling to the walls like trellised vines. Criss-crossing the thoroughfare like laundry lines are elegant silk strands. Nestled into the corners and crevasses are tightly wrapped, pulsating cocoons and masses of glittering eggs. Several massive caterpillars with strange multicolored bodies clutch to the delerium, gnawing at the crystals with their disturbing mandibles, when suddenly a fluttering flock of large moths with opalescent wings descend from above.

T hese These mutated insects have developed a curious lifecycle within the ecosystem of Drakkenheim's ruins. Large delerium deposits attract Hazewing Moths that flutter and land on the crystals to lay their eggs. After they hatch, the larval caterpillars consume enough delerium to wrap themselves into cocoons before transforming into adults. This lifecycle is not limited by the change of seasons in Drakkenheim, playing out rapidly over a few weeks. As such, the moths, caterpillars, egg clusters, and cocoons are frequently encountered together in large nests near rich fields of delerium crystals.

Throughout the ruins, clusters of delerium infested with Hazewing Moth egg masses are dangerous prizes, as the moths seek out the largest veins for their egg-laying grounds. Both the egg mass and the cocoon cause the breakdown of reality itself, leading to arcane anomalies and the accelerated progression of the Haze.

Hazewing Moth Caterpillar

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.29imghazewingmot inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.IO56vk0CbsZtnbGJ]{Hazewing Moth Caterpillar}

The undulating body of this monstrous caterpillar bristles with sharp, luminescent spines. The creature's skin is a disturbing tapestry of purples and greens, throbbing with an eerie, bioluminescent glow.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.27biohazewingmot inline]

Hazewing Moth Chrysalis

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.30imghazewingmot inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.RTnNDOenL7ZFRC6X]{Hazewing Moth Chrysalis}

Thick silvery strands fasten this bulbous glowing cocoon against a nearby wall. Within its crystalline shell, something pulses with unnerving, face-like patterns. These spectral visages seem to gasp and moan in silence. A thin mist rises off the surface of the chrysalis.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.28biohazewingmot inline]

Hazewing Moth Adult

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.31imghazewingmot inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.1DFfjSONfwOFVP2B]{Hazewing Moth Adult}

This large moth has brilliantly patterned wings that glimmer purple and green. The delicate membranes feature hypnotic shapes that resemble screaming human faces. The creature has a grotesque bat-like face with a curved antenna sprouting from its forehead ending in a bioluminescent lantern that gives off splashes of prismatic light. Its eyes are a mosaic-like fractal, and delerium dust drifts around it as it flaps about.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.29biohazewingmot inline]

Hypnotic Eldritch Blossom.name: Hypnotic Eldritch Blossom
Hypnotic Eldritch Blossom.text:
Hypnotic Eldritch Blossom

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.32imghypnoticeld inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.RcxUEy8Q2MIYJvOt]{Hypnotic Eldritch Blossom}

The multi-colored petals of this large lotus-like flower gently open. Light dances across its leaves and shimmering blossom in strange hypnotic rhythm. The colors seem to shift as it moves, at times creating unimaginable colors. As you gaze at it, maddening patterns fill your mind, and a wave of confusion sweeps over you, making it impossible to tell if your glance was for but a moment or a lifetime.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.30biohypnoticeld inline]

Kronen.name: Kronen
Kronen.text:
Kronen

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.33imgkronen00000 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.H64x5PUKtIzZu9aV]{Kronen}

In the shadow of the ruins, a pale, gaunt human appears. Their peculiar black cordlike hair shimmers strangely. With a bizarre gate they they stride forward revealing a monstrous form. Six skittering legs hold up its sprawling torso resembling the thorax and abodmen of a massive cockroach. Its chitinous shell gleams with a sickly sheen, a pair of long twitching antennae sprout from its head, and its arms end in clawed, human-like hands. Small oculi dot its forhead surrounding large compound eyes. Opening its mouth reveals not a tongue, but horrific mandibles. Countless small cockroaches dart among weeping holes covering its torso.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.31biokronen00000 inline]

Last Memory.name: Last Memory
Last Memory.text:
Last Memory

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.34imglastmemory0 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.cKBuDlHs9Pq5F9cS]{Last Memory}

Seared into brick and cobblestone is the ashen silhouette of a human form. Not a trace of their body remains, the blackened stone capturing the last imprint of their existence, the moment they were incinerated by the meteor's eldritch fire. Inexplicably, the silhouette animates into distorted shapes, as distant screams and echoing anguished whimpers fill your ears.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.32biolastmemory0 inline]

Living City.name: Living City
Living City.text:
Living City

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.35imglivingcity0 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.rG34ltU37ci2TdO0]{Living City}

An eerie light shines within the oddly intact yet ramshackle house across the road. The door hangs ajar, gently banging open and closed as the mist and winds whip through the dark streets. As you step inside the building, the lurching floorboards creak and groan. The furnishings are bizarrely orderly, and you notice nary a speck of dust or debris accumulated in the otherwise ordinary rooms. After a moment you notice a strange glistening liquid seeping out between the timbers, and the odd reddish goo that melts between the mortar of the bricks. Suddenly, the door slams shut, the windows close and shutter, and the entire room warps and shifts. Hundreds of yellow eyes open across the walls, grinning toothy mouths form on the ceilings and floors. Glistening barbed pseudopods reach up from the furniture, as you realize you have stepped right into the gullet of a patient predator.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.33biolivingcity0 inline]

Loathsome Gag Fly.name: Loathsome Gag Fly
Loathsome Gag Fly.text:
Loathsome Gag Fly

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.36imgloathsomega inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.g3GoPQ2OcUONnyO8]{Loathsome Gag Fly}

This massive fly buzzes through the air, bobbing and darting with a loud buzz of its wings. Its huge eyes make up most of its rotund form, saliva and mucus oozing from its small mandibles. Its abdomen is slightly translucent, with a purplish green liquid sloshing around inside its bloated form. It screams in a strangely human voice that sounds like it is crying for help.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.34bioloathsomega inline]

Lob Frog.name: Lob Frog
Lob Frog.text:
Lob Frog

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.37imglobfrog0000 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.YkxkQ9srZkW6yVk0]{Lob Frog}

The frog-like creature has sharp spines down its back, with mottled green and brown flesh; a large segmented mouth that bisects its face; and a large, black, soulless eye peering out from either side. Its insect-like pincers drip and gnash as it huddles close to a mound of translucent, sticky, octarine eggs throbbing and writhing with contaminated energy. It holds one of the throbbing spawn in its webbed hand, ready to hurl it directly at you.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.35biolobfrog0000 inline]

Octarine Tree.name: Octarine Tree
Octarine Tree.text:
Octarine Tree

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.38imgoctarinetre inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.U3iAchLIs1XbzSoP]{Octarine Tree}

Trudging through the thick overgrowth of Queen's Park Garden, you come across a massive tree with dark, nearly blackened bark, branches swaying and bobbing in the Haze-filled winds of the city. Unlike its barren and dying cousins nearby, its bright and flourishing foliage is alive. The ribs and veins of its thick purple leaves are shot through with pulsing octarine. Gently glowing upon its branches in small clusters are delerium crystals, sprouting from the tree like acorns. The whistling of the wind echoes through the delerium growths causing them to echo like eerie chimes. As you draw closer, the thick bough begins to shake and bend against the wind, and the tree's roots suddenly tear up from the soft earth. The massive shambling tree lurches up, and its darkened bark stretches and forms into a snarling grotesque face as it barrels towards you.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.36biooctarinetre inline]

Pyknic Maunder.name: Pyknic Maunder
Pyknic Maunder.text:
Pyknic Maunder

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.39imgpyknicmaund inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.CuSUJc5NnYVVaU0K]{Pyknic Maunder}

This horror is an amorphous mass of limbs, hands, mouths, and eyes. Among the disturbing mess are hands with eyes embedded in the palms that have mouths for pupils, fingers that end in hands with fingers that end in hands, eyes within eyes within mouths with wriggling fingertips for teeth, lips for eyelids, and grasping hands for tongues. Some of the many-colored eyes dart about in panic while others droop lazily as if falling in and out of sleep. Some of the mouths talk, citing obscure languages and bits of poetry, while the countless hands gesticulate frantically.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.37biopyknicmaund inline]

Imagine a raccoon and a potato had a baby. Just don't let it's speed make you think it isn't hungry.

Reality Cyst.name: Reality Cyst
Reality Cyst.text:
Reality Cyst

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.40imgrealitycyst inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.Xq366JSfG4cyMfO5]{Reality Cyst}

You come across a glistening mass of pustules that seem to grow directly out of the physical structures of the city, as if the natural wood, stone, and earth are alive. These cysts are a cancer growing within Drakkenheim. The very air around the cyst changes, the light refracts in incorrect patterns, and the lines and angles of its surroundings seem to fracture in incoherent designs. To look upon it is like looking at reality itself through a broken mirror. One that is both present and not present at all, where your every move and step are strained and confused. For a brief moment, you seem to forget what you saw at all, and the landscape around you seems unfamiliar. Have you been here before? How did you get here in the first place? Your mind strains to grasp these questions.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.38biorealitycyst inline]

Sewer Thing.name: Sewer Thing
Sewer Thing.text:
Sewer Thing

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.41imgsewerthing0 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.gHLZE4pOXXaTiTbp]{Sewer Thing}

The murky sewer waters churn as something below the surface stirs. A mass of debris, algae, and waste slowly rises from the water, and a sloping mass of sewage emerges with a gurgling hiss. Before you, a great shambling form launches towards you, grasping with its writhing tendrils, moving through sewage with surprising speed.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.39biosewerthing0 inline]

Shardmaul Manticore.name: Shardmaul Manticore
Shardmaul Manticore.text:
Shardmaul Manticore

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.42imgshardmaulma inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.EIgW72huYPSYpYpg]{Shardmaul Manticore}

Swooping above on thick leathery wings is a large lion-like predator with a disturbingly human head contorted into an expression of fury. Its body bristles in a thicket of crystalline quills that painfully jut out through its mane, along its wing-tips, and down its spine. It has a long, chitinous tail ending in a cluster of wicked stingers. Each begins as a spike of blackened bone but ends as a glittering delerium shard.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.40bioshardmaulma inline]

Skin Crawler.name: Skin Crawler
Skin Crawler.text:
Skin Crawler

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.43imgskincrawler inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.FX7wUN3akCsXmmuA]{Skin Crawler}

Out of the shadows you hear a sloping and squishing sound like someone dragging raw meat across the ground. The first thing you see are two arms reaching out from the darkness, the flesh sagging and drooping. The hands grasp the ground and slowly pull the creature forward revealing a squished pile of flesh resembling a human body without bones, organs, or muscle: simply a bag of skin that drags itself across the ground. Its empty eye holes and open mouth hang agape from its flopped over head, its legs dragging behind it as it pulls closer to you. It lets out a low guttural moan as it grasps towards you, hungry to fill itself with your insides.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.41bioskincrawler inline]

Skretch.name: Skretch
Skretch.text:
Skretch

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.44imgskretch0000 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.ZGNwGHT5Jcy3n49F]{Skretch}

A looming avian creature perches on the rooftop above, its body cloaked in dirty, ragged feathers. It curiously regards you with its two featherless heads, each borne on a long, crooked neck. Each head has large, round, bulging eyes and a hooked beak that drips corrosive saliva which hisses as it strikes the ground. The bird launches from its perch, opening its broad wings and short, fan-shaped tail, revealing a hanging, bloated belly that shudders with whatever half-digested contents rot within.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.42bioskretch0000 inline]

Undulating Polyp.name: Undulating Polyp
Undulating Polyp.text:
Undulating Polyp

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.45imgundulatingp inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.VBSxd8iaZoqERV24]{Undulating Polyp}

The strange creature appears to be a glistening growth of mucus-filled flesh upon a mass of boneless skin that slowly wriggles about. It shifts within its own reality, like a faded illusion, slipping between multiple locations. The growth jiggles and wobbles as it moves. Acidic mucus and saliva leaks from small, sharp mandibles. It hisses as it drips to the ground around it. Somehow, as the creature moves, reality around it seems to vibrate and fold as if the arcane energies found in Drakkenheim are concentrating around it like a slow and steady breath.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.43bioundulatingp inline]

Warp Witch.name: Warp Witch
Warp Witch.text:
Warp Witch

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.46imgwarpwitch00 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.pDdr2PUETgImh24p]{Warp Witch}

A lone figure draped in ethereal robes listlessly glides through the air, clutching a wrought iron lantern that glows in eldritch hues and green flames. A tattered hood conceals its face, but as you approach, they draw back their hood to reveal furious eyes and a hateful glare. Their mouth stretches unnaturally as they unleash an ear-piercing scream.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.44biowarpwitch00 inline]

I can still feel it inside my head like a nagging aunt. Every move you make isn't your own. Like a bad dream.

The World Ender.name: The World Ender
The World Ender.text:
The World Ender

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.47imgtheworldend inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.AKIChWZLty2czNa5]{The World Ender}

A storm of black clouds and sheets of octarine lightning fill the air, and unnatural otherworldly thunder crashes as a steady contaminated rain begins to pour.

Rising from the shattered delerium heart in a plume of eldritch Haze, stands a creature as tall as a tower, its bulbous head adorned with octarine delerium crystals that crackle and spark with arcane energy. These crystals protrude from its flesh down its neck and across its shoulders, as well as down its spine. Seven massive yellow eyes peer out from below a furrowed brow, over a reptilian snout with a wide set mouth that stretches across its head filled with rows of jagged teeth. Its large, elongated maw opens to reveal one hundred thin translucent tentacles that lash and dart out like one hundred tongues. Its wet skin is a mottled grayish purple, shimmering in unknown colors impossible to comprehend.

The Haze disperses in an instant as it rises from the Crater. Its four muscular arms end in hands with eight long spindly fingers, each tipped with a delerium clawed nail. Its large digitigrade legs end in veiny black hooves, and its rigid spine extends into three long, tentacle-like tails. The smell of ozone and sulfur fill the air, and a deep and booming voice utters words incomprehensible in a cadence unrecognizable to the human ear, merely coming through as a muffled tone of booming bass and high-pitched wails that causes your brain to seer in pain.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.45biotheworldend inline]

Mysterious origin

Characters who confront The World Ender are the first to ever do so: none in the World of Drakkenheim have encountered this creature before nor know of its existence. There is no possible way to discover any information about this creature — not even its existence — until it is released. Even powerful divination magic fails to reveal anything other than a vague omen of unstoppable destruction and terrible consequences for destroying the Delerium Heart. For this reason, the details presented herein are framed as information that could be discovered following the emergence of the creature from the Crater.

Destructive Rampage

The World Ender's actions damage and destroy buildings and structures. A creature within 10 feet of a structure that is destroyed must succeed on a [[/save dex 15 format=long]] or take [[/damage 8d6 bludgeoning average]] damage. Any creature inside the structure when it is destroyed has Disadvantage on the saving throw.

My world changed from touching the Delerium Heart. The world changed from what was inside.

Letter from Pluto Jackson.name: Letter from Pluto Jackson
Letter from Pluto Jackson.text:
Congratulations!

This is the last book you'll ever read. This isn't because you will suddenly forget how to read but more likely you will lose your eyes, an arm, the ability to comprehend language, or just die, and it's because some of you won't take this seriously. My name is Pluto Jackson and I am the greatest threat to the monsters of Westemar and beyond. This is my book entirely written by me! Well, it was written by some lowly scholar but completely guided and dictated by me. In it, you will find a compendium of truths and treasures about the greatest foes found throughout the known worlds. I have walked, run, flown, jumped, and fallen through portals and pathways to discover the intricate understanding of how these foes are put together and more importantly how to pull them apart.

Some of the stories you've heard about me are completely under-exaggerated. I have found myself in deep dungeons facing the brightest minds who staple body parts together. I have ventured into forests to hunt my troll rivals. I have crossed barriers into places where time moves in all directions. I have found myself fighting off dark creatures with a strange fascination with my neck. I have even spent entirely too much time breathing in the toxic air of Drakkenheim—all so I could bring this great knowledge to you.

Do not leave this book on your coffee table. It is not meant to be ornamental; it is factual and brilliant. Filled to the brim with drawings of the most hostile creatures, along with their tactics and fears. I have assembled this once-in-a-lifetime encyclopedia to help the weak and helpless achieve something big, something greater than themselves. A chance to walk a mile in the greaves of Pluto Jackson.

You're welcome!

Pluto Jackson

Introduction.name: Introduction
Introduction.text:
Introduction

What's in this Book

T his This book describes over 150 monsters from the terrifying World of Drakkenheim!

The monsters in this book are cross-compatible with both the 2014 and 2024 versions of the Fifth Edition Core Rules. When reading this book, text in bold usually references a creature or non-player character stat block, while text in italics often indicates spells or magic items.

The material in this book is meant for Game Masters! Many dark secrets and ancient conspiracies are explained in the lore entries for the monsters in this book! Here's what you'll find within these pages:

New Monsters

Chapters 1 to 8 feature new eldritch monstrosities, mutated beasts, and undead horrors spanning multiple tiers of play from CR 1 to CR 30. Each chapter features in-depth lore entries about the monsters, unique roleplaying traits, deadly combat tactics, and adventure locations with tactical maps.

Epic Bosses

Among the creatures detailed in this tome are mighty adversaries called Epic Bosses. These formidable creatures present a potent variation on legendary monsters intended as a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. General rules for Epic Bosses are described later in this introduction. In addition, @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimApp0A]{Appendix A: Ancient Entities} features Epic Boss game statistics for eldritch beings inhabiting the otherworlds of Drakkenheim!

Dungeons of Drakkenheim

This book also updates game statistics for many monsters introduced in Dungeons of Drakkenheim. If you're running that adventure, we've created these new monsters to fit within the ecology and challenge within that adventure. Furthermore, @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimApp0B]{Appendix B: Faction Agents} describes humanoid NPC game statistics representing members of the five factions originally introduced in Dungeons of Drakkenheim.

They call it Dungeons of Drakkenheim, but I don't remember any dungeons! Are sewers a Dungeon? Are basements? This is confusing.

New Conditions

@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimApp0C]{Appendix C} includes a breakdown of the new conditions you'll find in this book and how they work in play.

&reference[addled apply=false] &reference[bewildered apply=false] &reference[bleeding apply=false] &reference[bloodied apply=false] &reference[burning apply=false] &reference[clumsy apply=false] &reference[drakkenheimcontamination] &reference[dazed apply=false] &reference[defenseless apply=false] &reference[distracted apply=false] &reference[enfeebled apply=false] &reference[frozen apply=false] &reference[helpless apply=false] &reference[immobilized apply=false] &reference[jinxed apply=false] &reference[shocked apply=false] &reference[sickened apply=false] &reference[slowed apply=false] &reference[staggered apply=false] &reference[valor apply=false] &reference[weakened apply=false]

Contamination

The rules for contamination are included in the section for new Conditions:

  • Expanded Mutations. Featuring 50 horrific body-horror inspired mutations, this table introduces new effects and reprints the original 20 mutations from Dungeons of Drakkenheim.

  • Expanded Arcane Anomalies. This table expands the list of arcane anomalies from Dungeons of Drakkenheim from 20 to 50.

Save Ends

Throughout this book, we've used the shorthand “(save ends)” to certain conditions and game effects caused by monsters. This means that the affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themselves early on a success.

Monster Harvesting and Magic Item Crafting

This tome introduces a new way for player characters to craft magic items and equipment using components harvested from slain monsters.

The full rules are presented in @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimApp0D]{Appendix D: Crafting & Harvesting}. Our crafting system emphasizes adventuring to collect rare components, rather than spending gold, taking extended downtime, and making random skill checks. Instead, all characters need to do is find the parts required for an item, then bring those parts to an appropriate workshop.

Harvesting Components

Each monster entry in this book includes a Harvesting Components section, listing the components player characters can collect from it. Each monster's part has a Rarity from uncommon to legendary, defined by its challenge rating. These are detailed in @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimApp0D]{Appendix D: Crafting & Harvesting}

New Magic Items

@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimApp0E]{Appendix E: Magic Items} features dozens of new magic items, and recipes for each!

Epic Bosses.text:
Epic Bosses

I ntroduced Introduced in this book are special monsters known as Epic Bosses. These unique foes are designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party.


Epic Boss Rules

Thanks to their unique abilities, Epic Bosses have additional game rules which set them apart from normal creatures:

Turns and Initiative

Encounters with Epic Bosses

Epic Bosses are designed to capture the fantasy of an adventuring party facing down a single terrifying creature in a climactic battle. These are meant to be difficult encounters where the player characters must expend every remaining resource if they are to survive. This is counterbalanced by the expectation that an Epic Boss usually represents the final encounter of an adventure or story arc, so the player characters will be able to take a long rest and recuperate immediately afterwards.

As such, Epic Bosses have also been designed with the assumption that they need to bear the full brunt of the player characters “big guns,” such as Divine Smites, Action Surges, and spellcaster's highest level spells.

When creating encounters with an Epic Boss, consider carefully before adding any minions to support them in battle. If you want to make the encounter more challenging, consider adding traps, hazards, or other environmental factors before adding additional creatures to the mix.

Epic Bosses and Challenge Rating

The table below shows the recommended Challenge Rating for an Epic Boss given the player characters' level. Note that since Epic Bosses scale to the number of player characters, it is not necessary to use a higher Challenge Rating Epic Boss for larger or smaller parties.

Epic Boss Challenge
Character Level Recommended Epic Boss Challenge Rating
5th to 6th CR 7–10
7th to 9th CR 11–14
10th to 13th CR 15–18
14th or higher CR 19+

Characters of 4th level and lower do not have the Hit Points and resources to survive encounters with Epic Bosses, unless they are substantially more powerful than expected due to high ability scores, magic items, or player skill.

The World of Drakkenheim.name: The World of Drakkenheim
The World of Drakkenheim.text:
The World of Drakkenheim

Drakkenheim is no more. The once-proud capital of Westemär is a desolate urban wasteland, ravaged by an eldritch storm of falling stars fifteen years ago. The disaster that day was merely a prelude to the horrors that followed. Once the octarine flames that engulfed the city died down, a thick eerie mist remained behind. By night, a billowing aurora of prismatic light appeared, dancing over the city's corpse. Now, the forlorn streets are haunted by mutated monsters, twisted abominations, and undead wretches created by the otherworldly forces which have taken root in the ruins.

T his This book expands upon the setting introduced in our adventure Dungeons of Drakkenheim, which details the ruined city and five factions warring over it. The wider world beyond Drakkenheim is detailed in the setting book Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim. Throughout this book, you may find references to locations in Drakkenheim itself, as well as places in the neighboring nations of Westemär, Elyria, and Caspia. While we recommend consulting these books for the full information, here are a few details about the setting.

Quick Facts About the Setting

The setting of Drakkenheim diverges from the default assumptions of Fifth Edition in four key ways:

The gods are silent and distant. They don't manifest physically nor speak with worshippers, and do not interfere in earthly matters. Planar cosmology is mysterious and unknowable, but sages have still developed many conflicting (and wildly incorrect) theories.

Gods don't grant divine spellcasting powers. Instead, clerics, druids, and paladins tap into sacred energies through devotion, meditation, and resolve. Violating one's religious tenets won't result in a loss of these abilities, but a crisis of faith might.

Individuals can't become wizards through study alone. The arcane magic of both sorcerers and wizards alike is borne in the blood, which may be harnessed via practice and study. An important treaty between nations known as the Edicts of Lumen bars arcane spellcasters from holding noble titles.

High-level NPCs and spellcasters are exceptionally rare in the wider world. Despite their few numbers, such people still have a profound impact on society. However, Drakkenheim has attracted an uncommonly high concentration of such individuals.

Delerium

Delerium crystals are found throughout the ruined streets of Drakkenheim, jutting forth from piles of rubble, spreading along crumbling walls like crystalline moss, and glowing within the gaping crater. These iridescent stones radiate with vast magical energies which induce madness and mutate any matter they touch. While most deposits were left behind by the falling stars which devastated the city, the magical crystals slowly sprout and grow as their contaminated energies spread.

Although the crystals are dangerous, their tremendous magical potential makes them especially valuable to arcane spellcasters of all kinds. Delerium is readily used as the material component for nearly any spell, and the crystals can store and contain powerful magical essences which may in turn be used to power magical weapons, equipment, and other arcane contraptions. As such, the stones command a high price amongst mages and occultists alike, and an influential gray market has developed around prospecting, extracting, transporting, and selling the crystals. Nevertheless, the true origins and full properties of delerium have yet to be discovered.

The Haze

Swirling mists filled with indescribable colors of greenish yellow-purple settled over Drakkenheim. This magical mist is the visible byproduct of the intense magical radiation emitted by the vast concentration of delerium in the ruins. Normal creatures slowly gain contamination the longer they linger within the Haze and cannot benefit from a long rest while they remain inside it.

Dungeons of Drakkenheim & Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim

This book further expands the world originally presented in our adventure Dungeons of Drakkenheim and builds on the background lore for the wider world featured in Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim. If you own a copy of either book and are planning to run the campaign, you'll find a wealth of information herein to expand the campaign.

Dungeons of Drakkenheim is confined to the city of Drakkenheim itself, and covers the factions, conflicts, and locations within that city in detail. This book makes references to characters, locations, and the original five factions from that campaign, including the Amethyst Academy, the Followers of the Falling Fire, the Knights of the Silver Order, the Queen's Men, and the Hooded Lanterns.

If you don't have a copy of Dungeons of Drakkenheim, don't worry! While the lore and adventure hooks for the monsters are created with the campaign in mind, you should feel free to use the new monsters in your own campaign, reflavoring or adapting their lore and appearance to suit your setting.

Content Warning

Drakkenheim portrays a dark fantasy world. We recommend players and Game Masters have an open conversation at the start of the campaign to discuss their lines and veils. In support of this conversation, please note references to the following are common in this setting:

  • Violence, murder, blood, gore, cannibalism, and body horror.
  • Degenerative mutations which cause physical disfigurement and madness/insanity.
  • Rats, spiders, insects, demons, undead, ghosts, and other monsters.
  • Natural disasters, large-scale loss of life, civil war, displaced persons, refugees.
  • Moral ambiguity, social/political manipulation, religious zealotry, military nationalism

Explicit sexuality, sexual assault, racial prejudice, systemic racism, homophobia, and transphobia are not topics we want to explore in this world. Any inferences of such are wholly unintentional.

Factions of Drakkenheim

Five factions clash over the ruins of Drakkenheim, each vying for control over the ruins and the delerium found there. Their agents are regularly encountered in the world at large seeking to recruit new heroes to join their cause and additional resources to aid their embattled forces in the fallen capital.

Hooded Lanterns

Formally known as the 4th Provisional Expeditionary Force to Reclaim the Capital, the Hooded Lanterns are an irregular military drawn up from veterans of the Civil War and remnants of the old Drakkenheim City Watch. Led by the dour Lord Commander Elias Drexel, they wage a guerrilla war against the monsters, bandits, and scavengers that have taken root in their nation's capital. Each has pledged their swords and lives to rebuild Drakkenheim and restore the Realm of Westemär. Several noble houses have set aside their feuds to support the Hooded Lantern's efforts. These families believe once the city is restored, evidence will emerge revealing the true heir to the throne of Drakkenheim... or enable a cunning house to seize the crown.

Queen's Men

The Queen's Men are a loose affiliation between a hundred gangs of brigands, outlaws, and scoundrels, all owing fealty to the enigmatic Queen of Thieves. These reprobates prey upon the pilgrims, prospectors, and explorers drawn to the city, extort and rob adventurers, smuggle delerium to disreputable clients in distant lands, and plunder the fantastic treasures and incredible wealth left behind in the city. The Queen of Thieves dreams of building an influential and powerful criminal empire forged in the anarchy and lawlessness of the ruins, conspiring against the other factions at every turn.

Knights of the Silver Order

The Knights of Silver Order are an organization of oath-bound paladins and devout warriors sworn to combat supernatural evil, dark magic, and otherworldly incursions. The questing knights normally travel the realms in small bands and companies, and adhere to the Faith of the Sacred Flame, the dominant religion across the continent. They believe delerium is a contaminating blight borne of the darkest chaos, and have resolved to annihilate the corrupted crystals, slay every monster it has created, and hunt down diabolical mages who would wield its power to work evil magic. Now an entire regiment has been dispatched to Drakkenheim to carry out this righteous task, led by Knight-Captain Theodore Marshal.

Followers of the Falling Fire

The annihilation of Drakkenheim incited a serious religious schism within the Faith of the Sacred Flame. A new sect has emerged known as the Followers of the Falling Fire, who adhere to the prophecies of former Flamekeeper Lucretia Mathias. She attests that delerium is a divine gift, not a blight, and that these sacred stones will offer salvation against a greater darkness yet to come. The mainstream clergy have excommunicated Lucretia Mathias and branded her followers as an insane cult with heretical beliefs and blasphemous practices. Even still, masses of devout commonfolk now embark on a dangerous pilgrimage to Drakkenheim to take their place in a divine plan.

Amethyst Academy

The Amethyst Academy is a magical school for sorcerers and wizards where students learn magic in remote castles and secluded universities. Directed by a shadowy cabal of powerful archmages, the Academy also operates an enterprising mage guild that controls the manufacture of magical wares and orchestrates an influential arcane syndicate that provides occult counsel to the nobility of the continent. However, the Academy was dealt a terrible blow following Drakkenheim's destruction, as the city was home to their greatest stronghold: the Inscrutable Tower. Archwizard Eldrick Runeweaver leads the Academy's efforts to access the tower and safeguard the secret lore within. Meanwhile, their survey teams conduct ongoing re- search regarding delerium's supernatural qualities and unknown dangers. The mages plan to harness the crystal's vast energies to craft magical items and power new arcane spells.

The Original Drakkenheim Campaign

The material in this book is based on the Dungeons of Drakkenheim live stream campaign broadcast by the Dungeon Dudes, which ran from October 2018 to December 2019, and the follow up campaigns Shadows of Drakkenheim (which ran from January 2020 to December 2021), Untold Tales of Drakkenheim (played in 2020 and 2021), and Fate of Drakkenheim (which began in 2022).

It featured Kelly McLaughlin as Sebastian Crowe and Wilhelm Wolfsbane, Jill Danitis as Veo Sjena and Rudi Whittaker, Joe O'Gorman as Pluto Jackson and Wrath, with Monty Martin as Game Master.

You can watch it on the Dungeon Dudes YouTube Channel and find it on most major podcast platforms. Check it out if you're looking for inspiration for how we ran the adventures in this book, but be warned: spoilers abound! We've also created a wealth of instruction videos for players and game masters covering everything about tabletop roleplaying games, from character building to designing campaigns.

The World of Drakkenheim is a vast and ever-expanding place, and this book focuses the many monsters our heroes have battled over the course of the campaign. We've done our best to include as many monsters and nonplayer characters from the show in this book as possible, and we've included many more completely new ones for you to explore in your own game.

We think of our original livestream campaign as the “first draft” of our world, and as the World of Drakkenheim has grown, we've occasionally made the odd change, and several retcons too. If you've watched the original series and notice an inconsistency between this book and the show (there are many), the version in this book takes precedence. On the flipside, you should feel empowered to alter, change, and expand the material here, especially if doing so builds stronger connections or better stories for you and your players.

The events of our original campaigns are non-canonical with regards to this book, so several elements of Drakkenheim strongly connected to the original characters have been altered or removed. If you wish, the original “Drakkenforce” and “Duskwardens” characters may appear in your campaign as rival adventurers, but their stories have been set aside herein so your players may take center stage.

Monstrous Clans.name: Monstrous Clans
Monstrous Clans.text:
Chapter 4:
Predators of the Ruins

Monstrous Clans

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.95imgnstrousclan inline]

"It's a funny thing being in Drakkenheim and not being at the top of the food chain. It adds an extra thrill as you clunk clunk your way through the streets trying not to end up a snack. If you're looking for a fight it's best to close your eyes, take a deep breath, and listen for the screams of terror from those becoming a meal."

—Pluto Jackson

T hough Though contamination is wild and unpredictable, its transformative effects sometimes manifest consistently across certain animal species or individuals exposed under similar environmental conditions. These special circumstances have produced several unique groups of monsters which operate in a much more unified and coherent fashion—at least, compared to the ravening horrors and Delerium Dregs wandering the Haze. Initially banding together with others in order to survive, the most successful packs have carved out their own domains and territories within the ruined streets of Drakkenheim. Each has proven their mettle in battle against each other, the Hooded Lanterns, and expeditionary groups alike, each securing their own niche within the predatory hierarchy of the ruins.

While the ratlings are among the first of such groups most adventurers encounter in the Outer City of Drakkenheim, this chapter introduces several other notable monster families dwelling in Drakkenheim: the furious @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimPre04.JournalEntryPage.405hazewindharpi]{Hazewind Harpies} who rule the high spires, the ferocious @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimPre04.JournalEntryPage.402garmyr0000000]{Garmyr} wardogs who make their hunting grounds within the embattled Cathedral District, and the fishlike @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimPre04.JournalEntryPage.403deepdregs0000]{Deep Dregs} lurking within contaminated waterways beneath the city. In addition, contaminated energies have even gripped the old statues and defensive guardians of the city, granting these constructs a malign sentience.

A delicate equilibrium now exists where the competition between these monstrous warbands and faction soldiers has plunged areas of the city into a deadlocked state of guerilla warfare. As each monstrous faction has grown, formidable leaders emerge amongst them who seek to challenge this balance and emerge atop the pile, defeating their mutated rivals—and extending their territory beyond Drakkenheim.

Beyond their similar ambitions for power and dominion, each group is described in this chapter with their own background details, roleplaying traits, combat tactics, lairs, and game statistics for several variations found amongst them.

Garmyr.name: Garmyr
Garmyr.text:
Garmyr

A lthough Although once believed to be related to gnolls, these bipedal canids are unique to the Haze-ridden ruins of Drakkenheim. Covered in thick fur, Garmyr coloration and features vary from houndlike to wolflike, but all bare sharp teeth and claws. They form hyper-aggressive and predatory warpacks equipped with weapons taken from the many failed attempts to reclaim the city.

The Garmyr revel in their countless battles with adventurers, the Hooded Lanterns, and the Knights of the Silver Order for control over the Inner City of Drakkenheim. Although the roving warpacks make this district their primary hunting ground, Garmyr raiders have sallied forth from the ruins to plunder the countryside with increasing frequency. They live for the thrill of the hunt, taunting their prey as they pursue them into merciless ambushes. Though the warpacks are prone to infighting, a massive beast known as the Lord of the Feast rules the Garmyr as their overlord. When this terrifying monster calls the packs to battle, all the Garmyr set aside their enmity for one another to join the blood hunt.

Where exactly the Garmyr came from isn't clear. The popular belief amongst the Hooded Lanterns is that the Garmyr originated from mutated stray canines left behind in the city during its destruction, since the appearance and behavior of the Garmyr is not dissimilar to packs of wild dogs. However, amongst the Garmyr have been sighted hunters and thaumaturges bearing the symbols similar to Kromac, the old god of beasts and slaughter, suggesting the Garmyr have some sort of connection to the bloodthirsty deity.

Roleplaying Traits

Although they are cunning hunters, Garmyr care little for conversation, and even less for parley—and they seldom show mercy. Garmyr speak bits of Common, but typically communicate with one another through barks and growls. Adventurers and faction agents who have attempted to communicate peacefully with Garmyr are ignored at best, and more often eaten.

However, a few bold explorers have managed to observe Garmyr where they make their encampments, recording their behavior when not on the prowl.

Trophies

It seems that amongst the warpacks, strength and skill in the hunt is shown utmost respect. Garmyr display their trophies proudly to demonstrate their kills not only to their prey, but to each other. A twisted sort of hierarchy has formed, with the most accomplished and ferocious Garmyr leading the pack

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.tables.RollTable.C6sGOXNX872FHKUq rollable]

Scars of Battle

The fear of all Garmyr is to become wounded or decrepit with age, so that they can no longer partake in the hunt. However, elder Garmyr wear scars that identify their experience. The more battle-worn a Garmyr is, the more respect they garner from their peers.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.tables.RollTable.NQFCRirPA4GTlEAW rollable]

Warpacks

The Hooded Lanterns have encountered several distinct warpacks within the ruins, identified by these names.

  • The Gray Hounds are a pack of gray-furred hunters who have taken up positions along the city, holding Temple Gate. They wear rusted armor scraps taken from the city armories, and even adorn themselves in tattered green cloaks to mock the Hooded Lanterns.
  • The Blood Fangs are a vicious group of Garmyr wandering the Outer City, known predators of ratlings who adorn themselves in ratling pelts and skulls.
  • The Tower Dogs are an Inner City pack in a constant state of battle against the hazewind harpies near the Central Market Place. They wear feathered capes and harpy talons around their necks.
  • The Lord's Butchers are the personal warpack of the Lord of the Feast. They wear human skull pauldrons and cloaks stitched of the flesh of adventurers, covering themselves in the blood of their enemies.

Combat Tactics

The Garmyr are skilled hunters, and know how to use the ruins to their advantage. They have hunted the streets of Drakkenheim for years and know when and where to strike. They do not hide in the shadows, but rather howl and yip their way through the streets, surrounding prey and flanking with staggering precision. They revel in the fear they cause, and the thrill of the chase, the hunt, and the kill. Groups of adventurers, larger beasts, and some of the more iconic monsters of the city require a bit more tact. When it comes to this, the Garmyr lay clever ambush paths, sometimes sending some of their pack to lure a group of adventurers or a beast into a strategic location where they can surround it and ambush it.

Locations and Lairs

Temple Gate

A shanty town of crude hovels and wood platforms surround the once proud gate. This is now the forward command post of the Garmyr, and they use it to ward off adventurers and any creatures aiming to enter or leave the city proper. The streets leading to the gate on either side are rigged with death traps, pits, spiked logs, and all manner of crudely made effigies of bone and blood.

Temple Ward and The Sprawl

These are the prime hunting grounds for the Garmyr and throughout them are many forward camps and burrows dug into old, abandoned buildings or piles of rubble and ruins. A Garmyr camp is easily identified by the smell of cooking flesh and hanging bones and meat on hooks. The Garmyr decorate their favorite campsites with such symbols as to inform other Garmyr that this is a good place to set up camp for a hunt in the area.

St. Vitruvio's Cathedral

This is the home of the Lord of the Feast and his most loyal dog soldiers. The cathedral is covered in blood and gore, with the many victims of the lord's hunt hanging on meat hooks throughout the cathedral. The once divine building now lies in ruin, more akin to a slaughterhouse than a place of worship. The brazier that once held the sacred flame is now a monument of skulls and blood, identifying the grim blasphemy of its new occupants.

Adventure Hooks

Hunter / Hunted

A rather aggressive warpack has been hunting in the sprawl and making travel dangerous for all adventurers, prospectors, and many of the factions. Someone must track down this warpack and put an end to their hunt.

Dog Soldiers

A group of @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimApp0B.JournalEntryPage.2005hoodedlanter#hooded-lantern-scout]{Hooded Lantern Scouts} find themselves cut off. They send up a flare for aid, locking themselves inside an old cabin. They must survive the night with a group of ravenous @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimPre04.JournalEntryPage.402garmyr0000000#garmyr$1]{Garmyr} making every attempt to break in and eat them.

Garmyr Warriors

A pack of grizzled, bipedal canines charges toward you, howling with fury. They brandish scavenged weaponry and wear patchwork armor stitched together from the rotting hides of their previous kills. Some wear macabre jewelry made from fingers, ears, bones, and teeth. Their frothing mouths are filled with jagged teeth as they bark and growl.

Garmyr

Drakkenheim was once home to packs of wild dogs on the city's outskirts, as well as the trusted pets of locals in nearby farms and villages. When the meteor fell, every creature was changed. It's still unclear if the Garmyr are mutated dogs, humans transformed by the Haze into snarling beasts, or a combination of both. Regardless, the deadly Garmyr, led by the monstrous Lord of the Feast, roam the streets in packs hunting adventurers, travelers, and anything they can find.

Garmyr Bloodhound

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.88imgrmyr0000000 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.k111iWES8qzLdto8]{Garmyr Bloodhound}

Lurking behind the pack is a Garmyr wearing a tattered cloak and hood, leaving only its snarling snout exposed and its red eyes glowing from the dark shroud. Its aloof patience belies its predatory fury. It carries a wicked longbow strung with sinew, and its quiver bristles with thick, barbed arrows.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef01.JournalEntryPage.80biormyr0000000 inline]

Garmyr Berserker

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRef03.JournalEntryPage.89imgrmyr0000000 inline]

Statblock: @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.z3zkBEeMOecBcd93]{Garmyr Berserker}

An iron-clad muzzle locks the snout of this large, hulking Garmyr. It wears little more than a blood-soaked, tattered loincloth and rusted metal plates held in various places by leather straps. This creature carries two large battleaxes, built from rusted scrap metal and gnarled wood. Its octarine eyes peer angrily from its canine head.
