C ontamination Contamination has wreaked havoc on the skeletal systems of these Dregs, forcing spiked barbs to erupt from their flesh, which they can launch from their bodies or use as spurs to aid climbing.

Due to its agile nature and inherent Climb speed, the Spined Dreg prefers vantage points on low roofs or second stories of ruined buildings. It tends to avoid openly traversing the streets, and usually attacks from a distance or to leap down upon its enemies and grapple them. They will climb up walls to escape if reduced below half their Hit Points and outnumbered.

Tentacled Dreg.name: Tentacled Dreg
Tentacled Dreg.text:
I n In Drakkenheim, it seems tentacles are one of the most common monstrous mutations. Academy researchers have been unable to discern what specific reason tentacles may have for being such a consistent form of mutation. Theories have posited the idea that the Haze and Contamination originate in some distant watery plane of existence, or that the creatures best suited to survive in the Haze can use tendrils and tentacles to navigate easier. Whatever the reason, Tentacled Dregs are quite common throughout the ruins of Drakkenheim.

Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) check to Study a Tentacled Dreg, learning the following based on their result:

Combat Tactics

The Tentacled Dreg can use its tentacles to climb and swim much better than other Dregs, and so it likes to hide on perches or in water waiting for its unfortunate prey to come near. When it attacks, it Constricts its target, squeezing them to death with its many tentacles.

If outnumbered and below half of its Hit Points, a Tentacled Dreg will attempt to climb or swim to safety.

Haze Hulk.name: Haze Hulk
Haze Hulk.text:
C ontamination Contamination often causes creatures to vastly increase in size and muscle mass, becoming more like lumbering ogres or giants. Delerium Dregs who grow beyond the proportions of normal humans are typically called “Haze Hulks.” These lumbering forms, like their Dreg cousins, can take on many variations of mutations and growths as part of their contaminated existence. Haze Hulks are much more deadly, and much more ferocious, than a normal Dreg.

Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) check to Study a Haze Hulk, learning the following based on their result:

(10+) Nearly Unkillable. You know of the creature's Mutant Fortitude trait.

(15+) Crushing Move. You recognize the Hulk's Trample attack.

(20+) Strong and Tough. You learn the Hulk's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.

Haze Hulks are often found amongst other Dregs; they have the same general disposition and similar qualities as a common Delerium Dreg. However, when agitated or threatened, a Haze Hulk's ferocity outshines the Dreg's by a long shot. It will attack any creature it sees as a threat to itself or its fellow Dregs. The Haze Hulk will barrel in head first towards its foes, attempting to Trample them, slamming them with its massive fists. It is a relentless attacker and rarely flees from combat.

Cyclopean Hulk.name: Cyclopean Hulk

C yclopean Cyclopean Hulks have developed a singular eye as a focal point for the contaminated energy stored in their body, which they unleash as a destructive beam. They also have the unique ability to close their eye and wink out of their plane of existence temporarily, somehow triggering an arcanetemporal rift using their focused magic.

The Cyclopean Hulk is often a brutish protector for other Dregs. It uses its Eye Laser to disintegrate enemies into a fine delerium dust. The Cyclopean Hulk focuses its power on blasting enemies from afar or slamming them into the ground if they get close. It will then Wink out of existence, reappearing every few seconds to deliver a devastating blast from its eye before vanishing again. Cyclopean Hulks usually fight to the end, and rarely flee.

Big Linda.name: Big Linda
Big Linda.text:
H Hidden idden beneath the ruins of Drakkenheim, the enigmatic Queen of Thieves has a vast arena where the ambitious battle for a chance to win her favor. Those who climb its ranks must ultimately face the Queens favorite pet: a monstrous reptilian creature affectionately nicknamed “Big Linda.” Should any survive a minute in the pit—or manage to slay the beast—the Queen of Thieves promises anything within her power to grant. Of course, no one has yet claimed this prize.

Pit fighters are often puzzled by the Queens calm smirk when they believe they can gain her favor. Few realize that each victory brings them ever closer to a tragic end in Big Lindas jaws while a crowd of thieves cheers on their gruesome deaths.

Big Linda was first spotted in the ruins near Kings Gate hunting trolls. No creature like her has been seen, and it remains unclear how the Queen captured the beast. Its thought that she herself played a role, since no one hired for the mission is still alive. Even the crew she paid to deliver the caged beast met their deaths at the hands of a Hooded Lanterns patrol shortly thereafter.

It remains a mystery what creature transformed to become Big Linda, perhaps a mutated bird, or an overgrown gecko. The only creature remotely resembling it is the old dinosaur skeleton in the Drakkenheim museum, but even then, the many differences bring up a slew of questions as to its origin.

Although the Queen keeps Big Linda well-fed and securely contained, she is aware the monstrosity is barely under her control. Maintaining the beasts feeding schedule of fresh “challengers” is difficult and few handlers last more than a week before being gobbled up. The position is seen as a death sentence rather than any position of prestige amongst the Queens Men.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study Big Linda, revealing the following based on their result:

(10+) Hard to Kill. You know Big Lindas damage Immunities as well as its Rejuvenation and Regeneration traits.

(15+) Acidic Mucus! Youre aware of her Acid Spew attack.

(20+) Big, Clumsy, and Dumb. You recognize Big Lindas highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

Big Linda sends Acid Spew against groups of opponents. She then tries to optimize her Bite and Tail attacks by placing herself within her enemies. She is hesitant to leave the Deep Haze but is also not smart enough to resist chasing those who antagonizing her. She rarely flees unless severely wounded, wherein she will seek the safety of the Deep Haze to recover.

Grotesque Gargantuan.name: Grotesque Gargantuan
Grotesque Gargantuan.text:
T hese These mutated human monstrosities have grown to tremendous size. Delerium shards are merged into their disfigured bodies, and their muscles pulse with arcane energies as they lumber forward. Furiously territorial, these creatures are occasionally sighted hauling massive delerium crystals from the crater and placing them like obelisks in the ruins.

No one knows why these peculiar Gargantuans place delerium crystals in odd patterns, carving lines in the dirt to connect them. It's unclear whether these are random acts or convey some eldritch message. The prevailing theory suggests that these formations are linked to numerous Thin Places reported throughout the city. It remains a mystery whether these Thin Places already existed and are merely being marked by the Gargantuans, or if the Gargantuans are strategically placing delerium to open planar gates.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) check to Study a Grotesque Gargantuan, learning the following based on their result:

(10+) Vanish into the Haze. You are aware of the Gargantuan's Misty Camouflage trait.

(15+) Crystal Missiles. You learn of the Gargantuan's Hurl Delerium attack.

(20+) Nearly Indestructible. You learn of its Regeneration trait.

Combat Tactics

Grotesque Gargantuans are violently territorial creatures. Unlike the randomly mutated creatures found throughout the Haze, these hideous entities are more in tune with the arcane elements of Drakkenheim. Their form appears more intentional, as does their purpose, though the truth behind this intention remains a mystery

Gargantuans often drag chunks of delerium along with them, and their massive arms can swing or throw them with ease. They place the stones in odd formations around the city and, if witnessed by another creature who isn't a Dreg or a Haze Hulk, they will violently lash out and chase the observerer down. The Gargantuan hurls huge boulders of delerium at them. Whatever their intention is, they will not abandon their territory, or their work, and rarely flee from the site they are working in.

Gutbuster Hulk.name: Gutbuster Hulk
Gutbuster Hulk.text:
T he The Gutbuster Hulk is a grotesque creation of eldritch contamination. Its body has swollen to a massive size, and it continuously mutates to produce more and more rotting flesh that seems to ooze out of the creature. It tears at itself and pulls its guts apart, only to have them replaced with more growths inside. This creates a grim display as the Gutbuster throws its contaminated flesh at its enemies and vomits bile upon them.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) check to Study a Gutbuster Hulk, learning the following based on their result:

(10+) Gout of Acid. You recognize the Gutbuster Hulk's Bile Blast attack.

(15+) Cancerous Growths. You learn of the Gutbuster Hulk's Hurl Fetid Flesh attack.

(20+) Strong and Tough. You are aware of the Hulk's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

The Gutbuster is a massive, bloated hulk that constantly grows fleshy masses within its ever expanding belly. If left unchecked, a Gutbuster Hulk can grow to proportions so large that it crushes itself under its own weight. Ratlings love when this happens — it supplies them with food for weeks.

The Gutbuster maintains its form by ripping chunks of flesh from its body, hurling them at enemies. This contaminated flesh erupts in a shower of gore and necrotic fluids. A Gutbuster usually opens with this attack to ward off foes, and then waits for more flesh to grow to hurl it again. If its enemies close in around it, it uses its Bile Blast to coat the creatures in acid, or will Slam them with its massive fists.

The Gutbuster is slower moving than other Haze Hulks and rarely runs from a fight.

Hunter Hulk.name: Hunter Hulk
Hunter Hulk.text:
H unter Hunter Hulks lurk the streets in a constant state of hunger. Unlike other dregs, these seek out prey to eat, yet their appetites never seem to falter. Even more horrifying is the way a Hunter Hulk has adapted to the hunt: they can turn Invisible using a natural camouflage that has mutated their skin. These stealthy Haze Hulks wait in the shadows for their prey to draw closer, only to pounce out and scoop them up for a snack.

Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) check to Study a Hunter Hulk, learning the following based on their result:

(10+) Stealthy Assassin. You know of its Invisibility trait.

(15+) Hooked Arms. You learn of the Hulk's Lashing Tendrils attack and Reel Bonus Action.

(20+) Strong and Tough. You are aware of the Hulk's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

Hunter Hulks hide in the ruins of Drakkenheim, often Invisible, attempting to get the drop on their prey. Once the Hulk's target is in a prime position, it lunges out and whips its arms around them, pulling in the unfortunate target. The Hunter Hulk then devours them with its Belly Maw. If the creature breaks free, or if the Hunter Hulk is being too heavily damaged, it turns Invisible again and slinks back into the shadows. However, the Hunter Hulk will not so easily give up on its prey, and it may stalk the target and their party for a time, looking for a better moment to strike again. Sometimes it launches another ambush almost immediately, other times it will stalk them for several hours.

Juggernaut Hulk.name: Juggernaut Hulk
Juggernaut Hulk.text:
T he The Juggernaut Hulk's iconic helmet is something of a mystery. It is unclear if they fashion it themselves or if these Haze Hulks are some form of eldritch experiment. They have been found wandering the Inner City near the Kleinberg Estates, which has led to rumors surrounding the Pale Man and his constant dabbling in mutation and contamination. Some believe the helm is fastened over their heads in an effort for them to hone their senses and force a mutation to adapt. Somehow their mutations allow them to be acutely aware of their surroundings, without relying on sight, smell, or sound.

The Juggernaut prowls the streets acting as a sort of sentinel. It sometimes bands together with other Dregs as a bodyguard, and has been seen walking around the entrance to the Pale Man's estate. On rare occasions, a Juggernaut Hulk has been found closer to the city walls wandering aimlessly, drawn to groups of Dregs or places of strong contamination.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) check to Study a Juggernaut Hulk, learning the following based on their result:

(10+) Pure Destruction. You know of its Out of My Way trait.

(15+) Rusted Blades. You learn of the Juggernaut's Whirlwind action and Rip and Tear Bonus Action.

(20+) Renewing Flesh. You recognize its Regeneration trait.

Combat Tactics

The Juggernaut Hulk barrels forward in combat, slamming foes out of its way and swinging its blades wildly. Its main tactic is to knock enemies down and then drive its blades into them, bisecting them on the spot.

The Juggernaut Hulk does not flee and seems to shrug off most injuries. It will fight until its last breath with determination and ferocity.

Hair: Hair.

Protean Abomination.name: Protean Abomination
Protean Abomination.text:
O ften Often when continued exposure to contamination corrupts a creature, it can no longer contain its wretched form. Drakkenheim's mutations often allow a creature to adapt to its surroundings, or exaggerates its already horrible features. Eventually however, successive mutations begin to fold on themselves, giving way to the wholly unrecognizable and completely alien Protean Abomination.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) check to Study a Protean Abomination, learning the following based on their result:

(10+) Corpse Eater. You know of its Absorption trait.

(15+) Enveloping Mass. You uncover the Protean Abomination's Engulf feature.

(20+) Weak Minded. You recognize the abomination's highest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

The Protean Abomination is a hungry creature that hides in dark ruins, old basements, or in piles of rubble, squeezing out to devour anything that comes by. No longer capable of strategic or nuanced thought, the Protean Abomination simply wishes to feed, grow, and survive. It is very territorial and once it has chosen a place to nest, it will stay there for months or years, only moving if it has gone weeks without absorbing a creature.

When prey does wander by, Protean Abominations will attempt to move up to the creature and Engulf it. It wants only to absorb the creature into its mass and grow stronger.

If brought below half Hit Points, the abomination might try to squeeze into a location where it cannot be followed to escape, waiting patiently for less problematic prey.

Harvestable Components (Rare)

Animus: Aberration.

Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor.

Lenore von Kessel.name: Lenore von Kessel
Lenore von Kessel.text:
A n An emotionless porcelain mask obscures her face and a light shawl hides mutated hair. Her eyes are empty voids, swirling with magic and an occasional octarine glow.

When the meteor fell, chaos quickly spread. Castle Drakken went to high alert, gathering the von Kessels to be escorted out of the city to safety. Queen Lenore was the first to be told to evacuate. She resisted, believing there was no safer place than the castle. But as screams erupted from the city and the Haze flowed from the South Ward, she finally agreed. Her handmaidens gathered her finest dresses, jewelry, and possessions, then used a secret passage to reach the sewers. They were wisked away by a royal boat on a private waterway to the Queen's Park Gardens but no further.

On arrival, the contamination had already reached the gardens. Terror and confusion were everywhere. After seeing a guard grotesquely transformed by the Haze, she fled with her retinue to a

garden grotto, confusing familiarity with safety. They hid for some time, all becoming disfigured by the Haze. The Queen, afraid of her own reflection, had a mask fashioned to hide her features. She still resides within, waiting for her guards to return and say the danger is past. She is gripped by delusions that aside from her facial scarring, she has made it through the cataclysm unscathed.

This couldn't be more wrong. Her mind is broken and she clings to her delusionional view of reality. Anyone suggesting otherwise falls victim to her horrible gaze. She is a monster stalking the gardens, and like Drakkenheim's other horrors, she is dangerous and best left alone.

Before her transformation, the Queen was a strikingly tall and sharp-featured Caspian woman, with pale skin and vibrant orange hair. She married Ulrich IV to cement an alliance between House von Kessel and House Jones of Caspia, but refused to be a political pawn, asserting all of the royal privileges befitting a Queen. She was extraordinarily vain, hopelessly narcissistic, and frequently inebriated. She wore outrageously ornamented clothes, makeup, and jewelry, including a famous golden necklace set with eleven emeralds. She hosted parties and attended many social events where she delighted in her vassals' gossip, though was kind to her servants. She loved her children only as extensions of herself, and absolutely despised her husband.

Roleplaying Traits

  • Personality Trait. I speak softly imagining myself to be in a tragic fairytale while casting others in fictional roles.
  • Ideal. The world is a mirror held to my glorious reflection.
  • Bond. I obsessively crave beauty, decadence, and relish all art. I especially love my garden and my lilies. They are all I have left.
  • Flaw. I fly into an enraged fury at the sight of my own likeness or the names of my lost family members.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in History or Insight gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) check to Study Queen Lenore, learning the following based on their result:

(10+) Mutated Queen of Drakkenheim. You recognize she is an Aberration.

(15+) Deadly Gaze. You learn of her Radiant Gaze ability.

(20+) Formidable Foe. You understand her highest and lowest saving throws.

Combat Tactics

Lenore does not often outright engage in combat, throwing Dregs and her handmaidens at enemies who threaten her. She prefers to stay behind her minions where she is safe, relying on her Radiant Gaze to slowly disable and contaminate her foes.

If forced into melee, she uses her Tentacle Hair to attack and will take the first opportunity to escape if she can.

Haze Regent Lenore von Kessel.name: Haze Regent Lenore von Kessel
Haze Regent Lenore von Kessel.text: Curing Lenore's contamination is a vexing problem. Due to her madness, she manipulates any who try to help, twisting them to further her contaminated power. As Lenore's mutations evolve, she may become an even greater threat than before.

Pale Man.name: Pale Man
Pale Man.text:
F riedrich Friedrich von Lichten was once the head of a research department in the Enigma Ziggurat alongside multiple researchers and high-ranking mages. He had published seven different Academy texts on transmutation, human anatomy, the effects of magic on the physical form, and arcane mutations. Well regarded by his peers, many would say that Friedrich was as charming as he was sharp, and that his appreciation and dedication for the young mages who worked under him was unparalleled. He was known for talking at length about his findings, like a child excited about a new toy. To be in a room with him was sure to either teach you some new cutting edge arcane

discovery, or lull you to sleep as he droned on about the percentile chances of arcane anomalies causing beneficial reactions over problematic ones based entirely on whether or not you were carrying a wand made of elmwood or willow root.

After Drakkenheim fell, Friedrich became increasingly engrossed in the magical properties of delerium, the Haze, and eldritch contamination. He published another book titled The Effects of Arcane Contamination, Mutations, and How to Control Them, which detailed some less than orthodox concepts about transferring mutation or contamination. He had begun collecting various forms of insects in his labs and experimenting on them with transformations caused by delerium.

The Academy let him continue his work for a time, until an investigation into several missing mages quickly led to the discovery that Friedrich had kidnapped and experimented on his own apprentices. A secret lab was discovered, filled with caged Dregs of various types. They were all former Academy members, now twisted by monstrous experimentation. The most horrifying discovery was made when the Directorate sent in Academy arcane hunters, members dedicated to bringing in malfeasant mages, to apprehend Friedrich. The researcher blasted half of them away with never-before-seen contaminated magic, before dissolving into a swarm of bugs and vanishing into cracks in the walls.

The Silver Order was promptly contacted, and a bounty was put on Friedrich's head, with both the Academy and the Silver Order attempting to track him. In time, all leads went cold. The Academy seldom talks about the 23 mages who died at

Friedrich's hands; his lengthy writings were all removed from Academy shelves. Rare collectors covet his work as something of a legend, and rumors suggest that perhaps the strange and mysterious character known now as the Pale Man, working in secret in the Haze of Drakkenheim, helping contaminated individuals, and taking care of all the odd monsters of the city, might very well be what has become of Friedrich von Lichten.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Survival or Nature gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) check to Study the Pale Man, learning the following based on their result:

(15+) Contaminated Monster. You know of his Creature Type, Resistances, and Immunities.

(20+) Master of Contaminated Magic. You learn of his Contaminating Touch and Abrupt Contaminant Epic Actions, and his Aura of Fleshy Insects.

(25+) Nearly Deathless. Your are aware of his Crawling Flesh trait, as well as his weakest ability score and saving throw.

Combat Tactics

The Pale Man attempts to be polite and cordial to his guests. He tries to mask his terrible and cunning manner behind the guise of an academic interested in contamination, one who can aid the suffering. This is not untrue, as he helps those who come and are willing to pay for his services. But his experimentations are prone to mishaps. He delights in capturing contaminated creatures and attempting to bend their mutations to his will.

If threatened, or if his true nature is discovered, the Pale Man tries to contaminate a creature, triggering terrible mutations and using magic to worsens their conditions.

If reduced to 0 Hit Points, he explodes into a mass of bugs that crawls its way back to his cocoon, which is always nearby. He often keeps it in a secret location, one usually buried with only small cracks or holes leading to it. Perfect for a swarm of insects to get to, but difficult for anyone else.

Harvestable Components (Very Rare)

Animus: Aberration.

Fluid: Contaminated Ichor.

Hide: Skin.

Dust: Aberrant Dust.

Ratling Warrior.name: Ratling Warrior
Ratling Warrior.text:
R epresenting Representing the overwhelming mass of ratlings in Drakkenheim, these warriors have little skill and even less bravery, living a desperate life of scavenging and violence. However, a Ratling Warrior who survives and thrives may often find their own specialization or niche, becoming a @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRat03.JournalEntryPage.306ratlingburrow]{Burrow Warden}, @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRat03.JournalEntryPage.307ratlinggutter]{Guttersnipe}, or @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.guide.JournalEntry.drakkenheimRat03.JournalEntryPage.310ratlingalchem]{Alchemist}

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Ratling Warrior, learning the following based on the result:

(5+) Mutated Monstrosities. You are aware these creatures have an excellent sense of smell, Darkvision, are capable climbers and swimmers, and are Immune to Contamination.

(10+) Mob Attacks. You learn of the Ratling Warrior's Pack Tactics trait and Ratling Cunning action.

(15+) Swift, Weak, and Cowardly. You know its strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

Ratlings fight together in large groups to surround and overwhelm their foes with Pack Tactics. They use whatever rusty weapons they can find, or use their teeth and claws when nothing else is available. Occasionally, ratlings carry makeshift slings and hurl anything they pick up off the ground at their enemies: rocks, bones, or even chips of delerium.

However, ratlings flee and hide using Ratling Cunning when they don't have a numerical advantage over their foes. Indeed, they won't start fights if they don't outnumber their foes at least two to one, but while they outnumber their foes three to one or more, the typical ratling warrior can become insanely brave. When ratlings overpower their foes, they may even grapple them down and take them as prisoners to eat later.

Harvestable Components (Common)

Animus: Monstrosity.

Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor.

Hair: Fur.

Ratling Burrow Warden.name: Ratling Burrow Warden
Ratling Burrow Warden.text:
R atlings Ratlings look to the biggest among their number for leadership, forming posses around the largest and loudest, called Burrow Wardens. These ratlings get the privilege of bossing their comrades around, taking a larger share of food, and first pick amongst the spoils of their raids and ambushes. While Burrow Wardens might act like petty tyrants, these bullies also must constantly prove their strength and bravery lest a rival rise up to take their place. Wardens are often found at the forefront of any battle to demonstrate their might and ferocity. The smaller ratlings quite like this arrangement, as it puts their bully-bosses on the front lines during a burrow invasion. If the ratlings grow tired of one of their Burrow Wardens and want to replace them, they are in the best place to stab the big one in the back, cut them down if they're wounded, or abandon them alone against a deadly foe.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Athletics or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Ratling Burrow Warden, learning the following based on the result:

(5+) Powerful Ratling. You know these creatures have similar senses and Immunities as a typical ratling but are physically tougher and much stronger.

(10+) Aggressive Attacker. You are aware of the Burrow Warden's Pack Tactics trait and Shield Shove action.

(15+) Strong and Tough. You recognize the Burrow Warden's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

Ratling Burrow Wardens often form a tight formation during an attack, taking up their shields and poison-tipped spears to defend choke points. They especially like using their Shield Shove to push attackers into pits or other prepared traps in the burrow.

Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor.

Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh.

Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs.

Hair: Fur.

Bigger Linda.name: Bigger Linda
Bigger Linda.text: If Big Linda ever escapes the confines of the Queen of Thieves, the beast will no doubt return to the ruins of Drakkenheim and immediately seek out new hunting grounds. However, Big Lindas containment has stunted her true growth potential. Once freed, the longer Big Linda spends directly exposed to the energies the Haze, the more she grows. As she grows, new mutations begin to form, further amplifying her ferocity, predatory senses, and resilience. If left unchecked, Big Linda might become the apex predator of Drakkenheim—Bigger Linda.

Ratling Guttersnipe.name: Ratling Guttersnipe
Ratling Guttersnipe.text:
T he The small survive in the ruins through stealth, cunning, and a solid repertoire of under-handed tricks. Ratling Guttersnipes possess hard-won skills learned through bitter experience, and are rightfully respected and feared amongst their comrades. These grim-toothed ratlings have learned to plan careful ambushes, place deadly traps, and lure their prey into unfavorable situations. Honing their senses to a hair trigger, they are ready to kill quickly.

Guttersnipes arm themselves with choice equipment pried from the corpses of dead faction agents and explorers. These skilled thieves are bold enough to sneak outside the ruins on occasion to steal supplies, equipment, and food from faction strongholds, and even occasionally make nighttime break-ins to isolated homes and farmsteads.

The Guttersnipes observed the impact delerium had on humanoid creatures, and found inspiration for using delerium as a weapon, knowing that beyond the cut of a blade, the contamination is an even more deadly component to be dealt with. All Guttersnipes carry delerium weapons, often constructed simply by finding a sharp shard of delerium and fastening it to a makeshift hilt.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Sleight of Hand or Stealth gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Ratling Guttersnipe, learning the following based on the result:

(5+) Mutated Monstrosities. You understand these creatures have an excellent sense of smell, Darkvision, and are capable climbers and swimmers. They are Immune to Contamination, but have no other special Resistances.

(10+) Mob Attacks. You learn of the Ratling Guttersnipe's Pack Tactics trait and its Ratling Cunning.

(15+) Nimble but Weak. You know the ratling's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

Ratling Guttersnipes stick to the shadows, staying hidden as long as possible. They are likely to position themselves on rooftops or behind rubble, and often secure their locations with pit traps, flasks of oil, torches, or other devious traps when they are able. Once they notice their target is in position, Ratling Guttersnipes unload a volley of poison-tipped bolts, or unleash deadly traps. After their targets are weakened, the ratlings rushes in to surprise and stab creatures with their delerium blades, and then quickly dart back out.

As with all ratlings, if the fight turns against them, they will flee or beg for their lives.

Warlock of the Rat God.name: Warlock of the Rat God
Warlock of the Rat God.text:
A few ratlings possess magical powers, which they claim are gifts from the Rat God. Whether their magic truly comes from an otherworldly pact or is just a product of their contaminated mutations is unknown. Indeed, Warlocks of the Rat God will lie or embellish any whisperings or insight they have to convince other ratlings they speak directly to the great Rat God. They make robes out of rags, while carying gnawed bone wands, occult trinkets, bone effigies, skulls, and scrawled drawings. The Rat God's warlocks often whisper to themselves and take notes that only they comprehend.

Most ratlings fear and obey these warlocks. Warlocks seldom share their power with others, making it rare for a colony to have more than one, unless they are underlings of a more powerful spellcaster. Often, the warlock will hand-pick the fiercest Giant Ratling to serve as a bodyguard, or keep a veteran Ratling Guttersnipe as a personal assassin to remove potential rivals.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Religion gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Warlock of the Rat God, learning the following based on the result:

(5+) Otherworldly Pact. You are aware these creatures have an excellent sense of smell, Darkvision, are capable climbers and swimmers and this ratling's damage Resistances.

(10+) Potent Spellcasting. You learn of the ratling's Balefire and Conjure Swarms actions.

(15+) Commanding but Frail. You know the ratling's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

A Warlock of the Rat God does everything in its power to put “lesser” ratlings between it and its enemies. They deem themselves far too valuable to be put in harm's way, but are also inherently overconfident in their powers, convinced the Rat God protects them from harm.

A Warlock of the Rat God will have likely cast Mage Armor on itself prior to rolling Initiative, as most keep this spell active when venturing out of their burrow, or at the first sign of danger. They conjure a Swarm of Rats to pester their enemies, and use Balefire to pummel their foes. When their defenses are exhausted they cast Invisibility on themselves and attempt to flee using Teleport.

Giant Ratling.name: Giant Ratling
Giant Ratling.text:
O ccasionally Occasionally, a ratling just doesn't stop growing. Unfortunately, their brains seldom keep up with their growing bodies, as a result, most of the lumbering brutes are rather dim. These dumb hulks lumber forward into combat with total disregard for themselves or other ratlings, at times scooping up other warriors and throwing them towards their enemies. Some ratlings love this, and excitedly run alongside a Giant Ratling hoping to be hurled — sadly most don't survive the impact.

Giant Ratlings are the exception to the ratlings' rule of letting the biggest and strongest lead. Although these ratlings are often the largest of the pack, their inherent inability to lead, or form any strategic thought besides to smash and eat, makes them a great destructive force for a smarter ratling to use against its enemies. Often a ratling warlock or alchemist will command one or two Giant Ratlings and use them as living siege weapons, digging tools, or personal bodyguards against scheming ratlings looking to put a dagger in a superior's back.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Giant Ratling, learning the following based on the result:

(5+) Furry Monstrosities. You understand these creatures have an excellent sense of smell, Darkvision, and are capable climbers and swimmers. They are Immune to Contamination, but have no other special Resistances.

(10+) Grab and Bash. You recognize the Giant Ratlings Hurl Ratling and Enrage actions.

(15+) Powerful but Dimwitted. You learn the creature's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

The Giant Ratling will charge any enemy it sees that threatens its burrow or gets in its way. The ratling will Enrage and start hurling other ratlings at its enemy as it charges forward, bearing down on the creature with claws and teeth. These brutes are relentless in their attacks, and generally much braver—or dumber—than other ratlings. They are unlikely to flee from harm.

If the rest of the ratlings begin to flee, the Giant Ratling will follow, but it will usually be the last to turn tail as it enjoys pummeling and gnawing on flesh a bit too much.

Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor.

Ratling Alchemist.name: Ratling Alchemist
Ratling Alchemist.text:
A ll All ratlings possess a wicked cunning, but a few among them are gifted with an inventive spirit, reckless curiosity, and explosive intentions. Often beginning with a fascination with fire or the strange and erratic effects of delerium, these ratlings use improvised materials, unstable ingredients, and scavenged tools to experiment and tinker, building crude devices and sometimes ingenious traps. Two out of three ratlings who attempt to become an alchemist die in their own explosions, but the one that makes it often becomes a horrible force against their foes.

Study the Foe

A character proficient with Alchemist's Supplies or Tinker's Tools gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Ratling Alchemist, learning the following based on the result:

(5+) Chemical Exposure. You are aware these creatures have an excellent sense of smell, Darkvision, are capable climbers and swimmers and its unique damage Resistances.

(10+) Inventive and Cunning. You learn of the ratling's Repeating Crossbow and Delerium Bomb actions.

(15+) Nimble but Weak. You recognize the ratling's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

A Ratling Alchemist is a ranged combatant who keeps to the backfield, where they can safely snipe their foes with their crossbow. They are happy to take pot shots when their bodyguards go down, using their Covering Fire Reaction.

A Ratling Alchemist doesn't care about the wellbeing or safety of their fellow ratlings, and will throw its Delerium Bomb at foes even if their allies are in the blast area.

Harvestable Components (Rare)

Animus: Monstrosity.

Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Elemental Fluid.

Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh.

Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs.

Natural Weapons: Claws, Teeth.

Hair: Fur.

Swarm of Ratlings.name: Swarm of Ratlings
Swarm of Ratlings.text:
A n An individual ratling is a vicious and craven creature, but seldom do they pose a threat to experienced adventurers. However, even veteran Drakkenheim survivors and explorers know to fear when ratlings gather in sufficient numbers. When dozens form a rampaging swarm capable of pulling down much larger foes with their amassed furry bodies, and stripping flesh from bone with hundreds of gnashing teeth and hungry bites.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Swarm of Ratlings, learning the following based on the result:

(10+) Fighting Horde. You are aware of the swarm's Resistances, Immunities, speeds, and senses, as well as its Swarm trait.

(15+) Overwhelming Numbers. You learn of this creature's Chittering Mass and Scurrying Horde traits.

(20+) Neither Strong Nor Brave. You recognize the swarm's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

The Swarm of Ratlings is an alternative way to represent a massive number of ratlings, rather than needing to use dozens of individually weak ratling minions in an encounter against higher-level characters.

In battle the Swarm of Ratlings moves like a rolling tide, using its Scurrying Horde Bonus Action to close the distance with as many targets as possible. The swarm tries to move into and over the spaces of its enemies, so it can Bite them with Advantage using its Chittering Mass trait. The swarm continues making Bite attacks against a downed character in its space as the swarm goes into a feeding frenzy.

The Swarm of Ratlings is impossibly brave until it's reduced to 0 Hit Points, at which point the Scampering Survivors usually try to run away.

Harvestable Components (Rare)

Animus: Monstrosity.

Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor.

Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh.

Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs.

Natural Weapons: Claws, Teeth.

Hair: Fur.

Hide: Skin.

Ratling Pathogenist.name: Ratling Pathogenist
Ratling Pathogenist.text:
R atlings Ratlings are disease-ridden creatures, and the smartest amongst them have observed the effects these diseases have on their enemies. Studying the actual causes of diseases and learning to harness them against their foes is a point of pride for a Ratling Pathogenist. These twisted doctors consider themselves amongst the most brilliant ratlings.

The Ratling Pathogenist has several disease-ridden blades, needles, syringes, and a gas mask. It's surrounded by a haze of diseased gas and acrid fumes. Even getting close to one of these highly contaminated rats is enough to make one sick.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Nature or Medicine gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Ratling Pathogenist, learning the following based on the result:

(5+) Furry Monstrosities. You understand these creatures have an excellent sense of smell, Darkvision, and are capable climbers and swimmers. They are Immune to Contamination, but have no other special Resistances.

(10+) Infectious You are aware of its Plaguebringer Aura and Infection action.

(15+) Nimble but Weak. You recognize the ratling's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

The Ratling Pathogenist is a cunning killer and loves to riddle its foes with diseases. The ratling will release one of its deadly infections into a creature nearby and use Rampant Sickness to spread it to anyone nearby. Metastasis causes the disease to kill its target even faster.

The pathogenist prefers to keep their distance and will attempt to scurry away if cornered or forced to fight in melee. It will also run if it is alone, or if its allies are fewer than its enemies.

Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs.

Maw Vermin.name: Maw Vermin
Maw Vermin.text:
T he The Maw Vermin's exact origins are still a mystery—are they horribly mutated ratlings who succumbed to Drakkenheim's contamination or something more sinister? It may have been a rat that fed on too much delerium or the sickly scavengers of another dimension. Some ratlings worship Maw Vermin as harbingers of the Rat God, assuming it is the closest a ratling can get to becoming a ratling angel. Some ratlings endlessly gorge on delerium, hoping to transform into a Maw Vermin to be closer to their god.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Maw Vermin, learning the following based on the result:

(10+) Filled with Delerium. You recognize that this creature gained the Magic Resistance trait, and has Resistance to Acid, Poison, and Necrotic damage.

(15+) Chew and Spit! You learn the details of the Maw Vermin's Bite, and Glob Launcher.

(20+) Dim but Enduring. You know the Maw Vermin's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

A Maw Vermin is a primal creature that cannot comprehend anything beyond its next meal. Ratlings give them a wide berth, as it is just as likely to consume them as anything else. When a

Maw Vermin senses anything it can eat, it lumbers towards the meal, using its Grasping Maw to pull targets closer so it can Bite them. Maw Vermin want to consume anything in sight, using its own food to secure even more. It uses Glob Launcher to spit half-digested morsels, happily eating whatever mess is left over.

Harvestable Components (Rare)

Animus: Monstrosity.

Fluid: Monster Blood, Contaminated Ichor, Acidic Bile.

Organs: Eyes, Heart, Brain, Guts, Flesh, Glands.

Bones: Skull, Spine, Ribs.

Natural Weapons: Claws, Teeth, Tentacles.

Hair: Fur.

Oracle of the Rat God.name: Oracle of the Rat God
Oracle of the Rat God.text:
T hese These devoted followers of the Rat God are amongst the most gifted and powerful ratling spellcasters. Among the most ancient ratlings, only a handful exist. Most were among the first to gnaw upon delerium and transform in the days after the meteor fell. They have seen the rise and fall of countless ratling warbands and colonies. They are welcome in any burrow being seen as an omen for feast and fortune, often driving them to self-destructive excess, believeing the oracle is a clear sign it's time to rise up against their rivals. While Ratling Oracles claim to have visions of the future, they are far from master planners. Possessed with a mad certainty, their fervent proclamations inspire fury and murder in their fellow ratlings.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Religion gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study an Oracle of the Rat God, learning the following based on the result:

(10+) Divinely Resistant. You learn of the Oracle of the Rat God's Resistances and Immunities.

(15+) Fiendish Foresight. You recognize the oracle's Death Toll and Squeak of Doom actions, as well as its Tail Barbs Reaction.

(20+) Aware and Commanding. You know the Oracle of the Rat God's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

These revered figures are seldom encountered alone. Instead, they are often in the company of several Swarms of Ratlings and perhaps even borne aloft on a litter by a squadron of Giant Ratlings. They may even have several Warlocks of the Rat God serving them as underlings. These minions are disposable to the oracle, who commands their underlings to throw themselves against their foes with wild abandon.

In battle, a ratling oracle fights from the back, calling out proclamations of doom on their foes using Death Toll and Squeak of Doom. They mock their foes' attempts at any success, attempting to use Tail Barbs to turn an opponent's luck against them.

Rat King.text:
N ot Not to be confused with the Rat Prince, a Rat King is a mutated fusion of multiple ratlings into a single being of psionic might. Often the result of a catastrophic arcane anomaly involving a swarm of ratlings that fuses their tails together into a horrific knot. The resulting pillar of rat-flesh is a writhing and wriggling abomination. Other ratlings find Rat Kings terrible to behold and shun them from their colonies.

(20+) Powerful and Ponderous. You area aware of the Rat King's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

A Rat King gains a bizarre hive-mind making it highly intelligent and almost prescient. In battle, it lurches forward launching a barrage of psionic attacks, using Tail Whip and Psychic Blast to shred its target's mind.

Rat Prince.name: Rat Prince
Rat Prince.text:
T his This fearsome ratling ringleader has self-styled himself as the Rat Prince. Dwelling amongst the Rat's Nest Tavern burrow, the Rat Prince and his posse are the scourge of rookie adventurers exploring the Outer City of Drakkenheim. He rules because he's the biggest, strongest, and killed the last ratling who called themselves the Rat Prince. He dreams of one day conquering all the other ratling colonies and demanding all the other ratlings bow down to him.

Roleplaying Traits

  • Personality. The Rat Prince bullies the others like a despot. When speaking, the Rat Prince repeats words two or three times for emphasis. “Yes, yes, yes…”
  • Ideal. The Rat Prince loves killing, eating, breeding, and sleeping. Pretty much in that order.
  • Bond. The Rat Prince wears a makeshift crown and claims he's the ruler of all the ratlings in Drakkenheim. This is far from true, but good luck convincing the Rat Prince otherwise.
  • Flaws. Logic makes the Rat Prince confused and angry, unless that logic involves food. The Rat Prince holds the Rat God in equal fear and awe. He is very superstitious about necromancy, illusions, and enchantment magic. He is afraid of ghosts but loves fire.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in History or Insight gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study the Rat Prince, learning the following based on the result:

(5+) Fearsome Leader. You know he has the traits of a typical ratling, though he is much more formidable.

(10+) Delerium Teeth. You recognize the Rat Prince's Contaminated Bite attack.

(15+) Adverse to Logic. You are aware of the Rat Prince's strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws, as well as the flaws noted in the Rat Prince's roleplaying traits.

Combat Tactics

Leading other ratlings into battle, the Rat Prince is a ferocious combatant. He uses his Sacrificial Pawn Reaction to avoid attacks while firing his crossbow or attacking ferociously with his Contaminated Bite. He uses Ratling Cunning to ensure that he remains adjacent to another ratling he can use as a body shield.

Caught alone, the Rat Prince doesn't fight: he flees. If he can't, he cries and begs for his life. He will sell out other ratlings if it means his own survival. When this rat is cornered, he offers anything he can think of to convince characters to let him go free, and will claim he can lead characters to fantastic treasures, secret passages through the city, vast amounts of “the shiny,” and boasts that his favorable reputation amongst the ratlings can guarantee safety. Whether or not these are true is up to you. Unless the characters can make the Rat Prince loyal in some other way (through food, fear, or magic), he tries to escape at the earliest opportunity.

Bloated Hive.name: Bloated Hive
Bloated Hive.text:
T he The Bloated Hive is a product of contamination that seems to have turned people into walking hives of insects. Some suspect the honey farms on the outskirts may have been the main source of these strange mutations, causing the apiarists and their hives to warp together, fusing into a grotesque and tortured creature. Their upper torso and head are now a writhing mass of open pores like a beehive, with bugs swarming in and out. They lumber around the ruins looking for nesting places where their hive can thrive. Many Bloated Hives operate alone, but sometimes a much more horrifying event occurs, where a single colony begins to occupy multiple Bloated Hives, forming a horrifying network.

The Bloated Hive tends to hide itself in the dark corners of ruins, often seeking the most damp and warm locations in the city. Many hives have been found along the Drann River within the Inner City, a large group of them living under Champions Bridge, and even more in the sewers, Queens Park Garden, and a sparse few in the woods to the north of Drakkenheim. Whenever traversing into dark and damp areas in the city, be on the lookout for an increase in insect activity and the sound of buzzing.

A Bloated Hive cannot speak, and acts on the whims of its occupants more so than its own free thought. Its mind is now a broken thing, connected inherently to the hive mind of a swarm of insects, but within that is a tortured human struggling for sentience. Some Bloated Hives have been known to respond to kind words, trinkets of their former selves, or music they recognize. Though these moments of subtle sentience are fleeting, as the hive reacts quickly to the feeling of an unwanted psyche struggling for dominance within the hive mind and could trigger a frenzied tantrum if not handled delicately.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks to Study a Bloated Hive, recognizing the following based on their result:

(5+) Sightless Awareness. You know the creatures Immunities and senses.

(10+) Endless insects! You are aware of the creatures Spawn Swarm action and Disrupt the Hive trait.

(15+) Frail. You recognize the Bloated Hives strongest and weakest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

The Bloated Hive is usually a solitary creature that spends its time cowering in dark corners living out its cursed life as nothing more than a conduit for its colony. In combat, they focus entirely on keeping their distance from threats and spawning swarms of insects to defend themselves. If cornered, the Bloated Hive uses its Claws and Distracting Swarm before moving back into the shadows and attempting to escape and find a new nest.

Larger packs of Bloated Hives are much braver and more violent, and actively hunt and pursue targets until their numbers are less than their prey. Places where large colonies gather are dangerous. The Bloated Hives work in unison to protect their nests. Only if they become outnumbered do they flee.

Garmyr Bloodhound.name: Garmyr Bloodhound
Garmyr Bloodhound.text:
Although no less bloodthirsty, experienced Garmyr often become more patient and methodical hunters. They take up ranged weapons and prowl the streets, often leading small packs of their own.

(15+) Strong and Brave. You recognize the bloodhound'shighest and lowest ability scores and saving throws.

Combat Tactics

The Garmyr Bloodhound prefers to stick to rooftops and vantage points; moving from place to place, choosing a target, and hitting it with its barbed shot. The bloodhound chooses a quarry and focuses its attention on that target. Often, they are accompanied by other Garmyr who handle the ground assault, while the bloodhound focuses on slowing targets and using its allies to gain Advantage. If its target flees, the Bloodhound marks it as its quarry and leads the hunt after it.

If the Garmyr Bloodhound sees its allies losing, it flees before its enemies can reach its vantage point.

Garmyr Berserker.name: Garmyr Berserker
Garmyr Berserker.text:
Mutated to massive size, Garmyr Berserkers become so violent and murderous they no longer see friend or foe, only meat for the slaughter. Kept restrained by their packs, berserkers are unleashed during the hunt as living engines of destruction. Once the berserker starts swinging its axes, they become incredibly difficult to stop.

Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine a Garmyr Berserker, learning the following based on the result:

(10+) Permanent Rage. You know it cannot be Charmed, Frightened, or reasoned with.

(15+) Indiscriminate Attacks. You are aware of its Reckless trait and Retaliate Reaction.

(15+) Strong and Brave. You are aware of their strongest and weakest saving throws.

Combat Tactics

Once unleashed, the Garymyr Berserker uses Aggressive to close with its chosen target, using Howl indiscriminately then swinging away with its axes. Once engaged, the berserker is a mindless killer, and will attack the closest target to itself—whether an enemy or ally. Due to its madness, a berserker never flees.

Garmyr Thaumaturge.name: Garmyr Thaumaturge
Garmyr Thaumaturge.text:
A few among the Garmyr develop magical abilities, though it is not clear whether these powers are the result of inborn sorcery or a magical connection to some otherworldly entity. Regardless of the true origins of their powers, Garmyr spellcasters become influential leaders within the pack. Indeed, adventurers have observed Garmyr Thaumaturges building bone-shrines and conducting blood rituals, and speculation suggests that these Garmyr heed the whispers of the Old God Kromac. Others would rather assume that somehow the eldest of the Garmyr have tapped into blood and carnage, twisted by the inherent magics of Drakkenheim, and infusing themselves with unknown blood rituals, chants, and incantations that harness these energies to fuel their rage and malice.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Nature or Religion gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine a Garmyr Thaumaturge, learning the following based on the result:

(10+) Arcane Caster. You learn of the creature's Spellcasting ability and its spell DC and attack modifier.

Combat Tactics

The thaumaturge wades into battle surrounded by its allies. It attempts to position itself in a central location so its Aura of the Blood Moon trait affects as many targets as possible. It will use its Blood Call to target creatures from range; only when it has more than one ally on a target does the Thaumaturge consider running in and attacking in melee.

The thaumaturge will attempt to escape any situation where it is cornered or forced into melee, and if its soldiers numbers are dwindling, it will flee to recuperate.

Garmyr War Dog.name: Garmyr War Dog
Garmyr War Dog.text:
Many of the local hunters had dogs as companions when the city was at its prime. Dogs were common house pets, hunters, and friends to many of the people inhabiting the city. When the meteor fell and everything changed, many believe the most proficient of the hunting dogs became the war dogs of the Garmyr. Holding closer to their canine origins, these hounds still roam the streets on the hunt for prey and support Garmyr warriors in battle.

Using Pack Tactics, the war dogs attack in numbers, ganging up on a single target, knocking it prone, and ravaging it.

The war dogs are brutal fighters, and feel no fear, but if their numbers dwindle, they retreat to regroup. They prefer to attack as a pack, and with intention; if the battle becomes too chaotic and more than half their numbers are gone, they flee into the streets.

Garmyr Warrior.name: Garmyr Warrior
Garmyr Warrior.text:
Garmyr warriors make up the brunt of the garmyr forces. They rely on each other in combat, knowing that hunting as a pack will give them the edge. They often look for means to ambush their prey, and overrun them. They are ferocious and relentless hunters who will track their prey for miles, but will never stray from the twisting streets of Drakkenheim. Several packs claim their hunting grounds and compete with one another over who can hold the most trophies of their kills, hoping to curry favor with The Lord of the Feast.

Garmyr warriors fight as a pack, following their leader on the hunt. They choose the juiciest, most delicious-looking target as their prey, favoring unarmored or feeble-looking creatures. Garmyr group up and focus their attacks until they bring down their target, unless a more dangerous threat prompts them to respond.

Garmyr crave blood and close-quarters battle, closing the distance to attack with their bites even when it may be more advantageous for them to keep their distance using their spears. Garmyr don't stop attacking a foe once they've downed them—they start feasting instead. Garmyr make Bite attacks against downed foes in the midst of battle, making Unconscious and dying characters especially vulnerable to the Garmyr's appetites.

Garymr are mostly heedless in battle unless their numbers are significantly cut down. Although they prefer to start battles when they outnumber their enemies, they flee as the fight turns against them. However, Garmyr might also attempt to flee once they've secured a meal—a group of Garmyr who manage to down one character in a group might decide to scoop up the victim and enjoy their meal elsewhere rather than continuing to fight.

Lord of the Feast.name: Lord of the Feast
Lord of the Feast.text:
The Garmyr band together under a great warlord called the Lord of the Feast, who has grown a fearsome reputation as an expert hunter, tracker, and warrior. It seems that the Lord of the Feast enjoys hunting and killing for sport, and hanging his trophies in his grim cathedral. His favorite prey, of course, is adventurers—he revels in tracking them through the city and hanging their gear upon his trophy shelves.

The Lord of the Feast rose to power amongst the Garmyr when he emerged as a large, albino wolf amongst their pack. He was given the name Ghost due to his pale fur. Even at a young age, the Lord of the Feast was bigger than most other Garmyr. However, the creature was also cunning and smart.

He knew he could best most foes with brute strength, but learned to control his insatiable hunger for bloodlust to focus on the skills needed to take down larger creatures. Through patience, a skilled hand with a bow, and using tools to modify his arrows, the Lord of the Feast began proving himself the strongest and most skilled hunter of all the Garmyr.

When the previous warlord, a gray Garmyr named Blood-Wolf, challenged Ghost to one-on-one combat, the Garmyr gathered to watch the contest. They speculated that Blood-Wolf called for the challenge out of fear of Ghost's burgeoning abilities and influence. Many Garmyr questioned Blood-Wolf challenging a pup half his age to a death match, but Blood-Wolf underestimated how powerful Ghost had already become. The match ended within seconds when three arrows penetrated Blood-Wolf's chest. The first bound him in place, the second poisoned him, and the third reeled him toward Ghost, who then tore his head off with his teeth. Holding up the head of Blood-Wolf, Ghost called for the Garmyr to feast on the corpse of their fallen leader. He was henceforth known as the Lord of the Feast.

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action to examine the Lord of the Feast learning the following based on the result:

(5+) Difficult to Kill. You know of the creature's Regeneration ability.

(10+) Dangerous Archer. You recognize that he carries special arrows revealing his Poison Arrow, Ensnaring Arrow, and Harpoon Arrow attacks.

(15+) Cunning Combatant. You learn their strongest and weakest saving throws.

Combat Tactics

The Lord of the Feast stalks the Temple Ward of Drakkenheim with his war dogs, searching for glorious kills. He seeks out the most fearsome monsters, and loves picking fights with faction agents and adventurers. When a band of plucky heroes enters his territory, the Lord of the Feast tracks and hunts them until they leave the Inner City or he has their skulls.

The Lord of the Feast uses a variety of arrows in combat: Poison Arrow to debilitate foes, Ensnaring Arrow to stop them fleeing, and Harpoon Arrow to pull them toward him to engage in melee combat.

If the Lord of the Feast is reduced below 100 Hit Points, he attempts to escape, but regroups as soon as possible with more hunters in tow to continue the hunt.

Deep Dreg Warrior.text:
Dwelling in the contaminated sewers and waterways of Drakkenheim, a Deep Dreg Warrior is left with only dim memories of their former lives, their identities are fully subsumed by eldritch contamination and thralldom to the Duchess. When they engage in melee, the warriors use their Net to restrain their foes, and make melee attacks (with the bonus damage from Catch of the Day) to knock them Unconscious.

Deep Dregs Warriors flee whenever they are outnumbered or if they are reduced below half their maximum Hit Points. They swim to safety rather than die fighting, and prefer to fall back and retaliate after gathering reinforcements.

Deep Knight.name: Deep Knight
Deep Knight.text:
Champions of the Duchess, Deep Knights tower over others of their kind. They lead groups of Deep Dreg Warriors on excursions and important missions. The Duchess keeps a contingent of Deep Knights as her personal honor guard to protect her lair.

Deep Dregs.text:

Deep Sirens are the generals and confidants to the Duchess and often serve as the eyes and ears of their mistress. Once it has gathered information, a Deep Siren returns to the Duchess, and is often sent with the Deep Dregs to storm beaches, infiltrate sewers, or take over cities on stormy nights.

The siren doesn't like being in close combat, and always attempts to use Misty Step to move to a more beneficial position, then unleash Storm Lash or spellcasting upon their foes.

89bioepdregs0000.name: Deep Dregs
89bioepdregs0000.text:
The Duchess is a contaminated sea monster who haunts the shores off Ash Bay. However, the creature originally made its home in the sewer cisterns of Drakkenheim. As the Duchess matured and grew larger, it departed the cursed city via the Drann River in search of more plentiful prey and fresh thralls, bringing a new wave of contamination to Ash Bay. It deliberately destroyed the Empress Geraldine just off the coast of Drannsmund: the merchant vessel was transporting a vast horde of delerium to the far continent. The Duchess has slowly tended the new reef of delerium coral flourishing around the shipwreck, transforming it into her personal underwater palace.

Roleplaying Traits

The Duchess has powerful and otherworldly psychic powers. They can communicate telepathically, read the thoughts of mortals, and use their psionic power to turn mortals into its contaminated thralls. It makes deceptive offers that appeal to characters' deepest desires, manipulating them into embracing contamination. Those under its control slowly mutate, taking on horrific aquatic features.

The Duchess hopes to open a dimensional rift so she can conjure other beings like herself, styling herself no longer as a duchess—but an empress.

  • Personality Trait. “What horrific condition afflicts the land-dwellers! How awful must it be that you cannot live in the wonderful sea … such a terrible curse which keeps you bound to the land…”
  • Ideal. “My magic will weaken the curse which holds you to the land, so you might swim through the waves of my court, and be welcomed as one of my loyal subjects! Perhaps you will be worthy enough to become one of my valiant knights!”
  • Bond. “Come see the wondrous treasures of my Grotto! Gaze upon the opalescent, prismatic beauty of my prized coral. You may hold it in your hands, for a while, if you wish…”
  • Flaw. “I abhor the land, and will never set scale or fin upon it.”

Study the Foe

Characters proficient in Nature or Survival gain Advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks when they take the Study action

to examine the Duchess. They learn the following information based on their check result.

(10+) Eldritch Abomination. You understand her Resistances and Immunities.

(15+) Thought Control. You recognize her Deep Domination ability.

(20+) Water Affinity. You learn of the Duchess's Moisture Regeneration ability.

Combat Tactics

The Duchess never confronts her enemies on their terms, preferring to stay in her lair where it is safe. She ventures as far as the edges of contaminated water, knowing full well that the

water sustains her. When confronting foes in combat, she uses her Deep Domination on her enemies while calling in reinforcements with Call of the Deep. She grabs foes and flings them away to keep her enemies focused on her dominated minions.

Unless in her lair, she flees the moment she doesn't like the odds of a fight. If she is in her lair, she flees only if she is reduced below 100 Hit Points to attempt to find a new location in contaminated water to build a new lair.
